38910927.review:
A logic-based puzzle game completely devoid of any and all instruction, the first challenge of klocki is to deduce your controls. Following that, the game progressively introduces new mechanics which must be experimented with in order to discover how they work before you can actually solve the puzzles they're included in.

The game is short, with myself (one who typically completes games very slowly) completing the game in under 1.5 hours, but I would not count this against the game given its low price. And of course, your experience with vary depending on how much you enjoy logic puzzles and how quickly you can teach yourself new mechanics as they appear.

Overall, I would definitely recommend klocki to lovers of logic-puzzles. Avoid if dislike figuring out things for yourself.

This whole review also applies to the other game from the same developer which is called Hook

38517669.review:
(Disclosure: I recieved this game as a free steam gift from a friend.)

Despite there not being a single word anywhere in the game, I never had confusion on what to do, sign of excellent tutorial levels.
Gradual ramp up in difficulty, culminating in levels that are very daunting, but solvable through gradual chipping away at their pieces.
Took me a bit under an hour to beat, with me playing as fast as I can, but I enjoyed every second. Sounds and movement of each variety of puzzle piece is distinct and reactive to your mouse speed, which makes the game satisfying even just to interact with and listen to.

The game also gave me some almost primal satisfaction in the act of finding order and patterns in a chaotic mess, in a way that's kinda hard to articulate. The same sort of feeling completing a jigsaw puzzle gives you.

Overall this game is Just. Plain. Satisfying.

[h1] Klocki - o jogo sensacional de mover pedras [/h1]

Eu comprei porque estava muito barato. 
Comprei porque tinham sobrado uns troquinhos da Summer Sale.
Peguei esse jogo porque sim... não esperava nada!

[h1] Pontos Positivos: [/h1]

* O desafio! Confesso que nunca imaginei que o desafio seria tão interessante
* A forma como o jogo reinventa sua própria mecânica e te desafia no próprio desafio. Você começa movendo pedras para formar as figuras. Depois você move as pedras e gira blocos. Eventualmente você move três tipos distintos de pedras com comportamentos diferentes, além de mover blocos inteiros e outras coisas mais

* O teste de paciência e atenção que os desafios vão propondo à medida que você avança nos estágios próximo ao fim
* Pode parecer negativo para muitos, mas existir apenas UMA conquista (a de finalizar todos os desafios) foi pra mim um "gás a mais"

[h1] Pontos Negativos: [/h1]

** A trilha sonora enche "os pacovás" depois de um curto tempo (eu mesmo mutei o jogo e fiquei ouvindo minha playlist)

** Apesar de bastante desafiador, não posso negar que me surpreendi com a rapidez com a qual terminei o jogo (1 hora e 1/2)

** Alguma coisa (talvez no design, trilha ou algo mais) fez com que eu, apesar da diversão, me sentisse cansado com o jogo e nunca de fato fisgado.

 Creio que para um jogo casual de puzzle este jogo entrega o que promete e pelo preço acredito que mereça a sua atenção:
[h1] 8 [/h1]

Faltou alguma coisa para aquele "jogo excelente" - mas é um jogo muito bom. Gosta de puzzles e desafios? Pode experimentar este game sem medo.

37881154.review:
The game's name is klocki, and it remind me of Chinese Klotski, a sliding block puzzle game that I played when I was very young. And I played that single sliding lock puzzle again and again, I played it faster and faster.

As a klocki fun, it’s easy to imagine how excited I am when I see so many puzzles, some of which are hard to realize as physical. The difficulty of this game is getting higher as you go through the checkpoints, and it tells players the basic rules gradually. Some levels have its unique rule or knack, it’s still not difficult to be learned. The difficulty of this game is not high, you will walk through this game for about two hours. From lines to patterns, form plan to three dimension, it’s really an ingenious design, each level is so different. In this puzzle game, your brain is fully mobilized, and successfully solving these puzzles is a very interesting job. The background music also makes you relaxed. I’m surprised how the developers successfully add a stereo algorithm to the game. 

I bought it in a game bundle, the quality is excellent for the price.
9/10 according to me.

37855245.review:
Klocki is a great of example of silently guiding functionality of mechanics through geometry and the player’s own intuition and exploration.

Despite being a short game, it all feels well-paced. New types of tiles and spaces come up very often and really make the hour fly by. You never feel like you didn’t get enough time with any ideas either.

Every time a new piece was placed, it feels great to move it around for the first time, discovering its simple function. From here you begin to see how a piece moves with other groups of itself and what patterns emerge from there. Klocki then progressively becomes more and more rewarding as you see your skills with each type of piece combine until you’ve created rules and patterns that you apply on a final gauntlet of bigger puzzles

Meanwhile, an ambient soundtrack keeps your mind clear and the occasion lower tone played after finishing a puzzle provides a nice boost of endorphin.

Klocki is inexpensive and a great brief yet complete game worth picking up for an hour of meditative tinkering. It’s also got trading cards and an easy 100% if you’re into gridding up your steam profile.
I’m found to be really enjoying the games from Steam’s [i] Relaxing Puzzle Box Bundle [/i] featuring other games from Maciej Targoni and Wojciech Wasiak. On sale it’s a first-rate deal!

36034880.review: Klocki ist ein kurzes Puzzlespiel. Die Rätsel sind keine große Herausforderung. Tatsächlich sah es auf der Shopseite besser aus, als es eigentlich ist. Zugegeben: Es hat Potential, aber dieses Potential wird nicht richtig ausgeschöpft! Für 1,5 Stunden Spielzeit, ist es etwas zu kurz geraten. Es gibt keine Menüs, Texte oder Sprachausgaben, was dazu führt das dieses Spiel für jede Sprache geeignet ist. Das Spielprinzip ist leicht zu lernen und selbst wenn was neues hinzukommt, fuchst man sich schnell hinein. Nervig ist die Musik, welche ich nach ein paar Minuten abgestellt habe. Der Kostenpunkt lag bei unter einem Euro, was gar nicht mal so verkehrt ist. Es gibt 3 Sammelkarten, die man nicht in der Spielzeit bekommt (Man muss das Spiel etwas länger laufen lassen, wenn man die will) und es gibt 1 Errungenschaft, welche beim letzten Level freigeschalten wird. Es fällt mir schwer dieses Spiel positiv zu bewerten, da es wie schon gesagt Potential hat. Dennoch sage ich: Nicht Empfehlenswert!!!!

35583485.review:
[h1][b]8/10[/b][/h1] 

[h1][b]TLDR:[/b][/h1] 
Very well made, the puzzles get more difficult the farther you go. Great casual/relaxing game. 

[h1][b]Basically...[/b][/h1] 
A puzzle game with different "abilities" as you progress. You click to shift pieces on the puzzle and try to connect the lines  (pink line with pink, yellow with yellow, blue with blue, etc). Pretty simple

[h1][b]Graphics:[/b][/h1] 
Really creative and minimalistic look, which is what everyone is lovin' now. 

[h1][b]Controls:[/b][/h1] 
Click pieces to shift them/rotate them

[h1][b]Overall...[/b][/h1] 
It has great art and is worth buying, especially if it is on sale. 

[b]Pros:[/b] 
- Great art/graphics
- Creative and difficult (kinda) puzzles 
- Easy to 100% 

[b]Cons:[/b]
- None

35201975.review:
Gra Klocki została stworzona przez polaków - Macieja Targoniego oraz Wojciecha Wasiaka. Gra ta jest logiczną grą, w której musimy za pomocą różnych mechanik, łączyć ze sobą ścieżki, kształty czy inne ściany. Gra ma bardzo dużą ilość poziomów do przejścia, same poziomy są niekiedy ciężkie do przejścia, choć nigdy nie są niemożliwe. Gra ma bardzo prostą lecz przyjemną dla oka grafikę, bardzo uspokajającą muzykę oraz bardzo wysoką grywalność. Gra, którą polecam każdemu fanu gier logicznych.

PODSUMOWANIE:

+Zalety:
+Prosta i ładna grafika
+Kojąca ucho muzyka
+Poziom wykonywach poziomów
+Wysoka grywalność
+Liczba poziomów do przejścia

-Wady:
-Długość gry

OGÓLNA OCENA: 7,5/10

34989903.review:
While this puzzle game is short enough to finish in one sitting, it was enjoyable and fun to play. There were some puzzles that confused me and got me fiddling with the puzzle, but once I figured it out, i felt a rush of relief and joy of overcoming it. The color schemes were pretty and easy on the eyes and the patterns that were formed were beautiful looking. 

They throw you straight into the game, no menu or settings other than going back to past puzzles and muting, but I think that is for the best as this is a minimalist game and a minimalist setting it best. However, there are some parts where a lack of words does confuse you for a few seconds.

Overall, this game is a beautiful minimalist puzzle game and relaxing to play with. While there is no replay value, it is a puzzle game that you can play again. A game to relax to and not ruin your day.

Klocki is one of the shortest yet also one of the most brilliant puzzle games I have ever laid eyes upon. It is entirely soothing while actually providing quite a challenge. 34710141.review:
klocki, On MetaCritic, it shows it was developed by Megabyte Bomb. Released on the PC platform on Jul 13, 2016 and is also available on Iphone,Ipad. There are no user reviews yet as of this writing. (http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/klocki). 

On steam page, it shows klocki was developed by Maciej Targoni and Wojciech Wasiak. The same people who brought us Hook. klocki is also available on Linux.

To say klocki is just "a puzzle game" - it is a unjust description on this product. 
For me, I would describe klocki as creative, innotive puzzle game. Because it introduces mechanics/multiple combination of methods to solve a puzzle. This is what makes klocki interesting & fresh. It stand's out from the rest of the other puzzle genre games.

Controls, Audio and Visuals
It only uses Mouse control. No video/sound options. There's feedback sound on every block/click you make. The background music is light and relaxing - something very soothing.

Visually, its bright & colorful. 

Game Mechanics
klocki uses mix n match, rotating, reversi-like, number slide-like elementals to solve it range of puzzles. The difficulty gradually rises. So it does *not* shock the audience of the product. There's a little surprise at the last level puzzle. It shows this  is a labor of love.

My personal thoughts:
I don't really  play a lot of puzzle games because of my horrible past experience with them. The excruciating pain & frustration you put your mind through. The time and effort ..It feels as if my brain would [b]BURST[/b] if I continue further. 

Luckily, klocki does not put you through that sort of horrible gaming experience. There were some very tricky-crazy puzzles but it's still manageable. Overall, I was impressed with this simple, polished product. Good work with klocki, devs. Kudos. Keep up the good work.

I do have 2 points to share, hopefully the developers will take them into consideration for their future products.
[list]
[*]I would love to see a simple level design because there might be younger audience or people who are stuck in a particular level and unable to advance. It's a painful experience for them and at least with this design, they are given the option to skip a level and come back in the future to complete that particular level. This also serves as a replay-ability option and people would have an easier time making videos, showcasing klocki on youtube,etc.

I understand this request comes with revamping the whole level progression and unlocking achievement triggers. If you are unable to make all the changes for klocki, do it for future products. =)

[*]Video option: I would certainly love to play this in a window mode. It doesn't have to be full screen all the time.
[/list]


My Summary:
klocki was surprisingly relaxing and enjoyable - for me. That's not usually the case when I am playing puzzle genre games. lol. Creative mechanics, soothing audio, clean bright visual designs, I couldn't ask for anything more. It also has a fair pricing for this small scale of product. It's really worth it. I am pretty sure kloki has enough challenge for everyone; kids, teens & adults. On the scale of 0 - 10, my personal rating for klocki is a solid 8/10.

#Edit1: Had to to replace a word - else the sentence would be misinterpreted.

Los puzles me gustan.
No soy un obseso de ellos ni nada similar, pero me agradan.
Al igual que en "The Talos Principle" me resulta muy satisfactorio
cuando un puto videojuego reta a mi inteligencia. Una que, por otro
lado, tampoco se va a poner muy brava con estos temas, pues conoce
de sobra sus limitaciones y sabe que no es especialmente una lumbreras.

Aún con todo, la realización plena con la que se siente uno al pasarse
unos puzles tontos, no tienen parangón con nada.

Bueno, sí, con muchas cosas. Los parangones tienen esas cosas.
Que dices que no, pero al final es que sí. Es un límite ficticio.
Como pensar de adolescente que tu primera novia es la más guapa
del mundo y es la mejor. Y eso, técnicamente, no es así. Los putos
porcentajes, las probabilidades, el universo y esas mierdas. Así que
bueno, mejor vivir siempre en la ignorancia y vivir todo bien fuerte.

PD: La más guapa era la mía, no la tuya. Pringao.

34413271.review: Klocki — реально интересная, спокойная логическая игра с занимательным геймплеем. Здесь нет тайминга, очков, ограничений по количеству ходов, рекордов. Основная задача перед игроками простая и понятная — необходимо соединять между собой различные типы линий, расположенные на плитках. Чтобы соединить линии в единую цепочку, необходимо правильно переместить квадратики в блоке, вращать предметы, выставляя непрерывные комбинации. Кто любит спокойные головоломки, советую.

34126027.review:
Dans la lignée des [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/461840][i][b]Zenge[/b][/i][/url], [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/272040][i][b]Kami[/b][/i][/url], [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/266010][i][b]Lyne[/b][/i][/url] et autres [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/367580][i][b]Hook[/b][/i][/url] (du même concepteur, soit dit en passant), [i][b]klocki[/b][/i] est un puzzle-game sans grande prétention, mais au demeurant éminemment sympathique. Pour une somme tout à fait modique, il vous propose une séance de jeu dont la relative brièveté ne l'empêche pas d'être à la fois divertissant, relaxant et intéressant. Notamment grâce à des mécaniques qui, à défaut d'être révolutionnaires (il s'agit de déplacer des tuiles de diverses façons, afin que coïncident des formes et/ou des lignes), s'avèrent plutôt efficaces.

33921806.review:
Klocki is a short minimalist puzzle game where you move tiles around until every tile connects into its own shape(s). There are 82 puzzles in this game, and it took me about an hour and 15 minutes to complete it. There is only one achievment for the game and it's for finishing it. The ambient music is calming and not distracting. The puzzles were interesting, but not terribly difficult (there was only one that I got stuck on for any decent amount of time - the rest of them I could move around and sort of figured it out as I went).

I think, overall, it was a decent puzzle game that is worth its price if you are just interested in a casual puzzle experience to keep your brain active. One thing I wish they had was some sort of level counter and/or a menu where it showed all the levels by number, because as it is now you don't know how much content is actually in the game until you finish it and even then if you wanted to know how many levels there actually were (like I did for this review) you would have to page all the way from the first puzzle to the last counting them yourself. Of course, this probably isn't a huge deal with those who just want to play a game and when it ends it ends, but for those wanting to know the quantity of puzzles they are paying for that little added bit would have polished the game up more.

Maybe a little bit too many mechanics, though, for a game that's supposedly so minimal. I wasn't fond of the sliding one (I must say I never liked sliding tile puzzles), could have done a few more fun levels and without this one mechanic.

Overall, it's still a very good, and surprisingly enough, little puzzle game.

klocki - это тот самый момент, когда игровой процесс действительно увлекателен... когда дизайн не свербит в глазах... когда уровней не миллион и проходятся в сумме за час... когда не нужно делать однотипные движения получая за каждый "тык" по 10 ачивок... когда серое вещество в твоей голове начинает работать... 
Иногда мне казалось, что следующий уровень для меня будет непроходимым, но уровни не слишком замудренные, хотя и заставляют поковыряться и проявить своё внимание и мышление.

kolcki é um jogo que te apresenta mecânicas simples, mas a [b]curva de aprendizado[/b] vai crescendo em um ritmo muito bem equilibrado deixando tudo mais [b]complexo[/b] conforme joga. Cada coisa que você aprende, precisa [b]usar junto[/b] com todas as mecânicas anteriores.
Os puzzles consistem sempre de peças que precisam ser [b]encaixadas[/b], e são várias peças e [b]formas diferentes[/b] que isso pode ser feito, mas a maioria deles pode ser resolvido apenas pela [b]insistência[/b], não há nada tão fora da caixa. Apenas senti falta de um puzzle final que utilizasse [b]todas[/b] as mecânicas juntas.

PRÓS:
-minimalista
-musica relaxante
-treina muito a sua lógica
-vários mecânicas diferentes
-ótima curva de aprendizado
-funciona em todos os idiomas XD

CONTRAS:
-se você já for bom de lógica, vai achar os puzzles muito fáceis

(9/10)

33288040.review: This was a surprisingly fun little puzzler for me.  I'd seen this game come up a few times in discovery queues and finally decied to get it.  It starts off about as easy as it comes.  We're talking toddler level puzzles.  Then they get harder until you reach a few head scratch puzzles towards the end.  Nothing is overly complex however and they can be finished in about an hour with an achievement at the end.  The game lacks in features though.  You can move back and forward through what you've done before and turn off the music and that's about it.  No idea how many puzzles there are as there was no menu or listing of them.  No menu at all anywhere.  Escape closed the game for me and Alt-Enter windowed it.  It was pretty barebones.  In fact the only way you know you finished is by recognizing the first puzzles were back.  But overall, it was relaxing and fun and I didn't really want to stop playing until I'd finished them all.

如果你有些关卡感到困难，可以给个提示：

I really enjoyed every single bit of this game, I'm not really good at writing reviews, nor do I write a lot so here is a quick pros and cons list.

PROS : 
The price, for just under a Dollar, this is wonderful
The puzzles are mostly easy to understand
Good timing on switching things up to keep the levels being too repetitive
Really nice and relaxing music to help focus
So pretty and lovely to look at
Good challenges here and there, nothing too difficult but hard enough to get the gears turning
It also now has cards and an achievement

CONS :
Only options are for sound (on/off)
No level select menu
Pretty short (finished in about an hour w/o a walkthrough of any sort)
No real replayability here (even though I have gone through the entire game about twice now just for fun because I like it so much)

33159960.review:
klocki is a very fun small puzzle game, that caught my attention being a fan of "Hook" by the same developer. And I mean small, I finished in less than 2 hours. It has nice visuals and intuitive mechanics that are introduced gradually. The short length means the game never outstays its welcome, I never found a level tedious, or having to deal with too much of the same thing. All very varied and well designed puzzles that make you think. In the early levels you can get around by doing random moves but that's not going to fly later on. Good soothing music and sound too! Made for some great late night winding down.

Recommended!

As of writing this review the Linux version doesn't work full screen. Windowed fully playable, only a minor complaint.

33155241.review:
"Overwhelmingly positive".. mh the disappointment when a game does not live up to its positive reviews.. I have just started the game, but I feel I already want to review it for the one's who might be equally convinced by the positive reviews.

I have played similar puzzle games before (LYNE, Hooks, Hexcells, and those I would recommend all). And yes, this game has nice relaxing music, but the colours are a lot stronger than they seemed in the video. And that was not really relaxing for me actually. The games I mentioned are doing a way better job in creating a relaxed atmosphere with music and visuals. 
Now the puzzles are also kind of boring, at least there are too many easy ones. You only need one or two to understand the rules of a new system, but not 5 or whatever. Some more difficult puzzles were interesting, but then the colours were too strong for my taste and I just wanted to get it done to get a change of colours.

Maybe for a person who doesn't play other puzzle games and likes strong colours it might be interesting, but for other players who know this type of game, I would not recommend it.

33151907.review: The creator of this game must be absolutely brilliant, and for me, the game inspires genuine awe for the ingenuity of humanity. The puzzles gently and naturally introduce a bunch of mechanics and then masterfully interweave them to create a relaxing game experience that bends the rules of geometry and requires some creative thinking. Others have said the game is too short, and I can't comment on that yet, since I have only played a half hour and have yet to beat it, but I'd say if you like puzzle games, this one is definitely worth the asking price.

32750286.review: This is a low stress casual puzzle game, where you flip, rotate, and switch out tiles to make closed loops.  It sounds simple, but there are increasingly complex permutations (multiple cubes, shifting of tile directions and positions, black tiles that can't be next to other black tiles, or a combination of all of the above in one puzzle).  There are no time limits or move limits, it's just you exploring the minimalistic puzzles until everything works out.  It's a serene, calming experience, even as the puzzles become real brain teasers. There aren't a huge number of levels - it took me 90 minutes to complete the game, and I was doing other things at the time. But for a $1.00 game, it's a very nice casual experience.

This game was fun and challenging. I enjoyed almost of the mechanics as well, though I likely have a distate for it due to my experiences with that type of puzzle mechanic as a child. However, despite my personal preferences, the game molds together its mechanics rather well, which made for some very interesting levels. I'm also inclined to believe that each puzzle (at least the later ones) are able to be solved in multiple ways. All in all, a very enjoyable use of my time.

TL;DR - klocki was a fun and difficult puzzler with many well made mechanics. It has a decent amount of replayability and is a very nicely polished game.

又是作者的一款轻解谜游戏。。。。也又是一款能找回心灵平静的游戏。清脆的音效和简洁的画面实在是为这款游戏增色不少。而默认隐藏的菜单设计也最大程度的保留了画面的和谐美。游戏元素也是从少到多，从简单到复杂，而且每次增加新元素的时候都贴心的设计了教学关而没有使用任何文字。而作为一款解谜游戏，最核心的关卡设计做到了即使在游戏后期也可以十分灵巧的组合几乎所有解谜元素，实在是体现了作者扎实的关卡设计功底。虽然有时关卡比较复杂，但是难度却一直保持适中。而在最后一关，作者使用了特殊的方式来避免了戛然而止的结尾，简直完美。
总评9.8/10
相当优秀的放松用游戏。
本来实在是找不到问题所以想给满分的。。。但是转念一想好像这个游戏如果想长期玩下去的话续航素质不高。。。希望作者可以推出关卡编辑器，然后让玩家自己制作并上传关卡？（那样这个游戏就不会只是六块了@_@，而且关卡质量问题也会更让人头大@_@）
总之这个游戏还是相当推荐的啦~在闲暇时玩一会体会游戏传达出的宁静，真的是一种享受。

32233598.review:
If klocki were priced much higher than it is, I'd have to give this a thumbs down. But the fact of the matter is, the game is very good for its price.

klocki is a simple game: Make all the tiles activate by swapping, rotating, sliding, etc. Some tiles are 'wires' that need to be connected with no loose ends. Some tiles are black boxes that will turn into white circles when they're isolated from other tiles of their kind. Some tiles are circular and rotate on their axis; later levels will have you rotate entire chunks of the level to connect the lines.

It's a short game, so don't expect to spent a whole day playing klocki. And it's not massively challenging, either. All the levels can be solved with a little critical thinking and a solid thought process. But for a dollar it's a pleasant little experience and more than worth the money if you like simple puzzles and have nothing else to use that spare buck on.

32232906.review:
Usually with puzzle games, I find myself having a fun time, a soothing and/or challenging experience, for the first ten or twenty minutes before some actually difficult mechanics are introduced. Normally I'll try to brute force my way past this point or simply give up out of frustration. This game, klocki, resulted in the same experience, and while that mechanic introduced is one I have particular trouble with (slide puzzles), I stuck around because of what came before it. The first twenty-ish minutes of this game were a delight, very relaxing while remaining engaging, likewise surprising and impressing me with new mechanics and elements that were rewarding when overcome. So, looking for more of that, I kept trying and trying to get past the bits that stopped me, and after a good ten or twelve minutes, I was able to do so, learning from the experience, and the rest of the game flew by, not quite as hard as the initial roadblock but not quite as rewarding as the first stretch either. 

And that's what this game was, really. There's not a ton to write about. The graphics are fine for this sort of thing. The music is pretty good, reminding me a lot of A Winged Victory for the Sullen. Moving around various knobs and levers looks, sounds, and feels great. It's short enough that it doesn't feel daunting while also giving you a good chunk of game to get through (apparently I spent nearly two hours with this game, though it felt like quite a bit less). So what you're left with, after all that, is a game that is mentally and emotionally rewarding, which is what puzzle games should be. I'm no expert in the field, but I've played my fair share of puzzle games, and I can't remember one that delighted me quite like this one. Come to think of it, I cant think of one in a long while that I was able to beat before giving up out of frustration, which might be a big part of it. I was a bit let down by the final puzzle, though the ones that came before it sure were a challenge, so I suppose I should think of it more as a soothing epilogue than the final climax. 

In any case, this is a hell of a cheap game and it packs more of a punch than you'd think for that price. Buy it and put it on when you need to come down from a long day of work or just need a break from something. It's certainly worth that much.

[h1]- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------[/h1]
[u][b]GRAPHICS[/b][/u]
Graphics are fine even if they are a little blinding with some flashy colours.
[u][b]SOUNDS[/b][/u]
With an ambiant music the game feels relaxing, only the sounds doesn't fit in that category.
[u][b]GAMEPLAY[/b][/u]
The first levels are really easy : you need to switch the pieces until you made one or several closed tracks. After that the difficulty is increased. You have a 3d-view and unlock also some tiles that can only be rotated. Then the harder ones will have both rotating and moving tiles at a time.

The game will also features some black & white tiles, the aim is to have all of them white by separating them. That type of tile can't touch another in any adjacent side, if you want to solve the this puzzle. As previously said, the game will also these 3 mechanisms : sliding, rotating, separating.

Finaly in the later levels you'll have some bizarre shapes that you need, like the lines, to create a closed shape.

32020944.review:
[h1]"Puzzles like in a clockwork"[/h1]
Very nice puzzle game again. After "Hook" and "Zenge" this is another brilliant puzzle game where you play about 50-60 levels and unlock just 1 achievment. The puzzles variate from turning cube sides, flip different fields or shuffle logic. You have a given goal and try to assemble the puzzle together to reach that goal. Helpful are broken lines which you must stick together or same colored patterns which lead you to heart pieces. Nice game for 1 hour or more

[h1]Главное спокойствие![/h1]

Очень даже интересная игра-головоломка, мне лично  понравилась. Спокойная и логически понятная и приятная игруня. 
Что интересно, в этой игре нет меню, мы сразу же окунаемся в сам процесс, т.е. 1 уровень. если честно я даже не считала сколько их там. А увидев, что опять на том же уровене с которого начинала, поняла - игра пройдена(((

[h1]Проходит быстро время - летит оно вперед![/h1]

Я про время это к тому, что решила выбить карточки, думаю дай поиграю ну просто так - разведку провести на пару уровней, и заигралась. 
Понравилась в этой игре смена уровней, они плавно перетекают, сначала небольшое обучение потом сложнее, а потом уже все новые и новые виды головоломок переплетаются между собой и если честно, то очень трудно оторваться.
Жжаль, что села играть без наушников и не смогла оценить звуки и музыку. 

[i]Всем любителям головоломок советую![/i]

31907458.review:
Klocki to gra, którą mogę polecić w 100%. Jest to do tego gra bardzo, bardzo estetyczna i wciągająca.
Aż dziwie się, że ta gra kosztuje tylko 0.99 euro, ponieważ NIC w niej nie jest "skopane". Autor gry jest jak widać pasjonatem- stworzył minimalistyczną, aczkolwiek bardzo udaną grę logiczną, która ma na siebie własny pomysł. Klocki przypominają pod pewnymi względami puzzle, lecz tutaj zadanie jest utrudnione- należy tworzyć abstrakcyjne wzory, dopasowywać kształy co nie jest takie łatwe na późniejszych eapach gry.
Grafika w tej grze to estetyczny minimalizm, sprawiający jednak bardzo dobre wrażenie, nie ma tutaj przeszkadzajek i innych zbędnych elementów w tego typu grach.
Muzyka to istny majstersztyk- ambientowo relaksująca, z (moim zdaniem) optymistycznym przesłaniem.

Ludzie, aż żal tej gry nie kupić. Za 0.99ojro na steamie zazwyczaj znajdziecie ścierwa, gry robione przez amatorów Unity, którzy chcą złowić frajera na "Super zombie masakra/ Krew i Seks flaki". 

Klocki to gra naprawdę warta uwagi, do tego za śmieszne pieniądze warta dużo więcej. Jeżeli szukacie mądrej, relaksującej gry to polecam Klocki jak najbardziej! 
Moja ocena? Szczerze i bez trollingu 10/10!

I've played it once, some time ago, completed it, and now I've completed it again because of recently added achievement to unlock.

Klocki is a short puzzle game, very relaxing, with nice ambient music, pleasant sounds and minimalistic graphics. I love games that tickle Your brain, and this is one of those games. The game consists of 30 or so puzzles while constantly adding new mechanics to keep You interested. I don't have any issues with this game, it's working flawlessly, You won't experience any bugs at all. The only thing I could hardly even try to moan about would be the time needed to complete it. I've managed to beat it twice in 2 and a half hours. But it's fair considering its low price. Thumbs up.

On a side note, check out other two games by this creator. Oo and Hook are also very fun and relaxing, good quality games.

Rodzaj gry: Logiczna
Czas przejścia: 1h -1,5h
Cena: 0,99 euro
Ilość etapów: 82 (jeżeli dobrze policzyłem)

Klocki to świetna gra logiczna, polegająca na układaniu klocków (NO NIE GADAJ), tak aby ułożyły linię mającą początek i koniec. Albo dużo końców. Grę przeszedłem podczas jednej sesji (no dobra dwóch, bo mi w środku gry prąd odłączyli, ale tego samego dnia), i gdy tylko myślałem, że to rozgryżłem, i gra robi się dziecinnie łatwa, nagle dorzucany jest nowy element, całkowicie zmieniający rozgrywkę (pewne etapy będą mi się śnić po nocach). Warto też wspomnieć o udźwiękowieniu. Jest genialne. Nie znajdziecie tu głośnej muzyki, wybuchów, i combo na 300 ciosów, rodem z japońskich bijatyk. To poprostu klocki.

Grafika: 8/10
Dźwięk: 9/10
Rozgrywka: 10/10

Średnia 9/10

31689549.review:
This does exactly what it says on the tin - it's a visual spatial puzzle game with a set series of levels.  It has pleasant uncomplicated visuals and a complete focus on the puzzle.  Some levels are simple, especially the ones teaching you new ways to solve things, and others become quite challenging, without ever quite crossing the frustrating "argh this is too much" line.

It builds complexity gradually, making sure you never end up staring at a screen wondering what to click on or why, but still leaving you with challenging questions on *how* to use what you can click.

The only criticism I can make is that a friend who is severely colour-blind got stuck on a couple of levels and had to fiddle with contrast a couple of times to enable him to make out some of the "done or not done" lines.

31684591.review:
Unlike their other games, there's no achievement for finishing this. As I got into the rhythm of solving the puzzles I was so in the zone that I didn't notice the levels had rotated back to the beginning after the last puzzle and solved the first 3 puzzles again before I realised my mistake.

For a dollar, this is a light cheap little toy game that you'll plough through in an hour. It could be a great lateral thinking puzzle for kids who would get a lot more time out of this game.

Recommended at a dollar or less.

A great, cheap puzzle game. Albeit a little short.

I paid 67p for this game and it took me around 70 mins to complete (under 1p per minute of gameplay). Puzzles are easy at first, but as you progress, new mechanics are introduced that make the game a little more difficult.

The game isn't over difficult to the point where you feel you have to take a break (à la The Witness) but there certainly is a bit of thinking required towards the end of the game, and despite the length, I'd be sure to purchase a sequel if one is made.

Do you like to solve puzzles? Then just spend a buck and download Klocki.
It's something like the puzzles on MillerWorldInc. It gives you a puzzle, you solve it, and then the next one comes up. You aren't rushed so you don't feel pressured to hurry and can take your time working out the solutions. 
The visuals are clean and the background music is relaxing if you want it on. 
It's easy to save your place because you just hit Esc...done, and the program will remember where you left off when you return.
It's a great little puzzle game to have on your desktop to 'fiddle with' when you have a moment or two to kill.
It also has replay value. It's something that you can constantly come back to from time to time.
Repeat: "Do you like to solve puzzles? Then just spend a buck and download Klocki." Now(;

31487108.review:
Klocki es un juego de puzzles, para pasar un rato tranquilo y entretenido. Es original, pero su potencial no parece haberse aprovechado por completo. Sus alrededor de 80 niveles podrás completarlos en una hora, aproximadamente, y se te hará demasiado corto. La música de fondo ayuda, acompaña a la perfección al tempo del juego, pero esto no es suficiente para decir que es un buen juego.
Quizás destaca negativamente la sensación inevitable de estar frente a un título inacabado. Sin menú de inicio, sin un final (por sobrio que sea), tan solo volveremos al primer nivel en un bucle infinito. Su ausencia de marcador, ni de indicador de nivel... en fin, sólo los niveles, y poco más. Además, la dificultad es muy baja para este estilo de juegos, por lo que nunca representará un reto, y eso lo hace empobrecer demasiado.
La idea es buena, pero el resto se queda atrás. Me es difícil recomendarlo.

NOTA: 5/10

Bôf. Je n'ai pas aimé. Je vais quand même mettre un avis positif parce que sur des critères objectifs, à part l'interface globale qui est pénible, ce petit jeu de puzzles présente de la variété, de la logique, une difficulté croissante... que demander de plus à ce type de jeu ?

Juste que personnellement je me suis ennuyé, les puzzles du début sont très très faciles, ceux du milieu sans réelle difficulté si on a un peu l'habitude du genre et vu que, sans que ce soit ni spécialement vilain ni bâclé, il n'y a pas la douceur poétique d'un Zenge par exemple pour trouver le temps moins long. Seuls ceux de la fin sont vraiment costauds mais il ne m'ont pas satisfait en ce que la plupart du temps, la difficulté vient de ce que l'on ne sait pas ce qu'on cherche. Pas trop mon truc de partir au hasard jusqu'à avoir une idée de la cible.

Moyen plus.

30461575.review:
How much would you pay for a coffee? And how long would it take to drink said coffee?

I bought [i]klocki[/i] this morning, and sporadically throughout the day, I was compelled to come back and play again. And again. And again. And now it's all over. Short and sweet. Worth it? That depends more on you, but I heartily recommend it. That's the tl;dr—like puzzles? Buy this game.

Having also played Maciej's [url=store.steampowered.com/app/367580/]Hook[/url] I had high expectations, and was not disappointed. Yes, there is really no replayability, but at just over a dollar Canadian, I felt I got my money's worth. With that said, Maciej, if you read this, do feel free to create more puzzles like this. Or perhaps, like [url=store.steampowered.com/app/265890/]Hexcells[/url], another puzzle game I loved, try to create a version the offers more replayability, [i]á la[/i] [url=store.steampowered.com/app/304410/]Hexcells Infinite[/url]. I would certainly buy it.

Overall, this is a short but pleasant puzzle game, with a minimalist design that speaks to me, and a great set of game mechanics. The tiniest quibble I have is the introduction of the black squares—a mechanic that took me a little longer to figure out than the rest. Still, I cannot fault the game design for that. This is well thought out and worth your time, as brief of an experience as that might be.

Gameplay: 9/10
Audio: null (I muted it. Sorry!)
Graphics: 9/10
Replayability: 3/10

Overall: 8/10

30442341.review:
What a great little game!

I initially played this through Kongregate, and was quite pleased to see the game for sale through Steam. 

Simple, minimalistic, no instructions.

Make connections, light up the lines and shapes, spin and swap blocks about, and that's pretty much the premise of Klocki. 

The gameplay is easy and smooth, the ambient sound track is great and there's no text. 

There's just over 80 puzzles (at this time) and some can be a little challenging, and all of them, I enjoyed. 

I took my time on this, and spent about 90 minutes getting through them, so, although not a lengthy game, it can get your grey matter thinking about things.

There's no massive re-play value, and for less than a quid, what do you expect?

Only a few of the tiniest niggles. Level selection and mayby acheivements. That's it. 

If you enjoy a minimal game, that sometimes gives a challenge, then for the princely sum of 79 English pennies, this one's a winner and should be in your library right now.

30182737.review:
PROS:
beautiful and minimalist visuals
nice ambient soundtrack
puzzles are great
The mechanic that isn't great (the sliding block part) doesn't take up a huge chunk of the game
nice minimalist aesthetic overall

NEUTRAL:
This game doesn't hold your hand, mainly because it doesn't need to.

CONS:
The sliding-block puzzles. 'Nuff said
Rather short (it took me less than 1 hour to finish) with no replay value

CONCLUSION:
While it's short and has no replay value, the (mostly) great puzzles, beautiful visuals, nice and unintrusive background music, and overall great minimalist aesthetic made that short amount of time very enjoyable, and you should buy it if you like puzzle games and liked the online prototype/demo.

P.S:
I know it says I only played it for 0.1 hours, but I actually played it for 55 minutes. It's just the Steam playtime counter reset the time to 5 minutes for some strange reason. Don't ask me how or why, because I don't know how that happened, but don't worry, I played the game for much longer than 0.1 hours.

30149473.review:
На момент написания обзора у игры 97% положительных отзывов всего и 99% недавних. Чувствую себя сволочью)

Подходя к вопросу рекомендаций, то я отойду от концепции траты денег на игру (12р на скидках, тут и говорить не о чем) и остановлюсь на необходимости тратить время на прохождение. 

Если вы, как я, ищете возможности заставить мозги поскрипеть, то лучше пройдите мимо: большинство из около 80 уровней решаются интуитивно и являются прозрачными чуть ли ни с первого взгляда. Те 10-15 уровней, что вызвали хоть какую-то сложность...Не стоят они того, чтобы тратить на игру полтора часа и продираться через рутину простых уровней. 

Но если хочется какой-нибудь простой головоломки, чтобы отдохнуть и расслабиться, то klocki может обеспечить вам это нехитрое дело.

Обновлено 19.05.17: добавили карточки и достижение. И если первые дали просто так, то для получения достижения пришлось перекачивать игру и просто включить. Такое себе.

30085480.review:
klocki is a minimalistic puzzle game developed by Maciej Targoni, the same person who developed HOOK, another minimalistic puzzle game. 

Pros:
-It is almost perfect minimalistic puzzle game. There is bright colours but not overwhelming, the music and sound effects are not intrusive and are relaxing, the puzzles are challenging but not frustrating. This leaves me enjoying the game, rather than "grinding" to get to the next puzzle
-The game itself is really cheap for the amount of content. For R12 (~$1) you get a good amount of time out of it. (I finished the game within an hour)
-It is easy to pick-up and play, not difficult to figure out what you have to do

Cons:
-I honestly don't have anything to put here.

This impressed me just as much as HOOK did. If you love puzzle game with a minimal feel to them, definitely give this a go.

10/10

A short (1–1,5h), minimalist and aesthetic puzzle game.
After 10 very easy tutorial levels it's neither hard nor easy — and that's the point!

It literally sooths your mind. 
Tidying up tiles on the board feels like putting thoughts inside your head into neat little drawers, exactly where they belong.

The great thing either is that it speaks for itself. You need to figure out the rules entirely on your own. There is no single word used in the game, just pleasantly colourfull tiles, elegant shapes, chaos, order and you.

29625592.review:
Klocki is a cute little puzzle game. Its interface is minimalistic. There isn't even a menu! You open the game, it opens at the next unsolved puzzle. You can turn on/off sound and there is a 'back' button to go back a puzzle. That's it. There are no other UI elements, menus or buttons.

The puzzles are composed of puzzle pieces (like in jigsaw puzzles) that you can manipulate (move or rotate etc.) The goal of the puzzle is to arrange these pieces in a way to make the pattern on them 'closed'. I am not really sure how else to describe it. 

Solving them is fun and relaxing at the same time. The game is quite short and can be finished in about 2 hours.

29510931.review:
[h1]Good, but way too short.[/h1]
Described as minimal puzzle game, "klocki" (literally "bricks" in Polish) is exactly that.
Game is so minimalist, that it doesn't even have menu, not even level selection menu - after you finish last level, game cycles back to first one and you can switch between completed levels by pressing next/previous level.
There is no text in game, rules are never explained, instead, progressively more complex levels are built in such a way that player will figure rules out on his own. First level has only two tiles that can be swapped, and from there, game carefully builds very complex puzzles, with myriad of possible combinations, but always solvable purely by logical analysis. Trial and error is never necessary. I very much enjoyed watching how game starts with very simple rules and then, builds something complex.

Graphic style is minimalist indeed. Simple  shapes, simple shades, and simple gradients give it clean and clear look. Music doesn't get in the way, instead works to build mood of serenity. I liked "artistic" side.

My only complaint, is that game is too short, it took me 40 minutes to complete all levels - unless you plan to replay some of them, don't expect to get more than 1 hour out of Klocki, whether it's enough to justify the price, is up to you.

29142530.review:
It would seem that I finished this game in little over an hour, so if you're looking for something challenging to while away the hours then it's probably not for you. 

If, however, you're interested in visually elegant, experimental but fundamentally casual puzzle games, then it's a real steal.

The gameplay involves sliding, rotating and otherwise manipulating tiles into pleasant patterns. Different tiles can be manipulated in different ways, with more complicated levels requiring tiles of different types to be interlinked across orthogonal planes. The gameplay of some later levels can feel a little noisy, but I rather enjoyed the process of navigating a convoluted process in search of a visually simple solution.

Klocki's fundamental appeal is aesthetic; notable touches such as the lack of in game instruction, written interfaces or move counters help to create an isolated but pleasant world in which experimentation is rewarded and mistakes are without consequence.

Belépsz, elkezdődik a játék, amikor végigjátszod az utolsó pályát, elkezdődik elejétől. Egyedül az ami van az a játék és a zene. A játék lényege kb. annyi, h vannak kis négyzetek, mindegyiken különböző csíkok és úgy kell elhelyezni a négyzeteket, h a csíkok egy összefüggő vonalat alkossanak. Folyamatosan nehezednek a pályák, újabb és újabb módszerek kerülnek elő, hogyan mozgathatjuk a négyzeteket, egy idő után már 3D-ben kell gondolkodnunk. Nem frusztrálóan nehéz, de azért megmozgatja az agytekervényeket. A zene, a letisztult egyszerű grafika és a nem túl nehéz játékmenet miatt tökéletes kikapcsolódó játék.

29090735.review: Aestethically pleasant and visually interesting, but ultimately uninspired -- less a puzzle game than the spacial reasoning portion of an IQ test given a graphics upgrade. The difficulty curve of klocki remains far too long at "insultingly easy" and barely passes into "mildly puzzling" at its peak. What challenge it does pose derives less from clever mechanics and intellectually stimulating puzzles and more from sometimes unclear rules and odd ambiguities caused by the game's own, admittedly nice, aethetic getting in the way. Klocki's worst sin is that it is dull in a pretty, inoffensive way, but surely one can do better than dull but inoffensive? Take a shower. Eat some oatmeal. Look out the window for a while -- or perhaps regard a painting or particularly facinating patch of paint on the wall. The world is your oyster.

28934856.review:
Не преувеличивая можно сказать, что klocki - одна из лучших игр всей эпохи видеоигр. Она без слабых мест. Можно ругать, что мало, но, с другой стороны, ее очень много - часов 50 для первого прохождения. Просто в такой шедевр хочется играть и играть, чтобы он вообще не заканчивался.

klocki - глоток свежего воздуха. Это действительно "игра", а не, как принято выражаться, "кино". Не ждите здесь роликов или диалогов как в Mass Effect. Это олицетворение классической puzzle game, а не тем, во что превратились puzzle game в этом поколении. 

Самое поразительное в klocki - это ощущение "роста". И речь идет не столько о прокачке персонажа в цифрах, сколько об улучшении самого игрока. Это поразительная история проб и ошибок: сначала кажущаяся просто непроходимой, но потом - очень понятной. 

Говорят, что klocki - игра для мазохистов, что это чрезвычайно сложная игра, в которой хочется разбить контроллер. Но так говорят не игравшие или игравшие недостаточно. Здесь просто нужно забыть правила, которым вас обучили в других играх. Это медленная игра, в которой нужно оглядываться и совершать обдуманные действия. 

Научившись этому понимаешь, что ранее непроходимые места теперь не так страшно посещать. И пройти их очень даже реально, хотя первичные попытки доказывали обратное. А самое смешное, что осознаешь это не когда цифра уровня персонажа зашкаливает, а когда уверенность в собственных умениях доходит до определенного уровня. 

В этом и прелесть klocki. 
Это, безусловно, шедевр.

The only negatives I really have for this game are that it's too bloody short, and when you complete the last puzzle you get unceremoniously dumped back onto the first puzzle. My exact reaction: "Wait. Is that it? Did I win? Yeah, I guess I did."

Very minimalistic design, which is great if you're into that sort of thing, some cool mechanics, and really nice background music. I would gladly play three more hours' worth of these puzzles if they existed.

So, do you like puzzles? Is a dollar for an hour of fun in a neat little game a good value proposition for you? Did you get more Christmas money than you know what to do with? If you answered yes to one or more of these questions, you should buy this game.

Klocki is probably one of the best puzzle games I think I have ever played. The perfect balance between self-discovery and challenge, and it has a minimalist UI that you don't even notice is there.

You reach a puzzle that you haven't seen before, and once you solve it, you feel like you have accomplished something with no direction, just good game design. The game progresses very smoothly, and at no point have I found myself looking for solutions to solve the puzzles. At the price? 10/10 I literally can't fault this game.

From the same developer behind Hook, which I also really liked. This is just a minimalistic tile-matching puzzle game, no words, no achievements, just ambient music and lightly challenging puzzles. I didn't find it as challenging as Hook because there's really no way to fail in klocki, or even make any invalid moves... I guess the worst fate that can befall you is aimlessly clicking around. But for the price, it's ultra-minimalist puzzle fun.

The only thing I might add would be some sort of par for each level; a few times I wondered how far off I was from an optimal sequence of moves.

28593210.review:
After a disappointingly small number of levels, most of which are depressingly trivial to solve, it abruptly restarts from the first level, just when it was starting to look like it might possibly eventually get challenging and interesting.

It has some nice ideas, but it's very poorly executed, and ends up being much more frustrating (for entirely the wrong reasons: not  due to difficulty, but to lack of it and the extremely small number of levels, and the even smaller number of even slightly challenging ones) than enjoyable.

If you enjoy puzzles you'll end up wishing you hadn't played it, because it's essentially a very short and limited demo or tutorial for a game that you would actually enjoy, but that won't ever be released.

I'm almost convinced the real intention of the developer was to troll the players. :(

28511412.review:
给个大概的流程概念吧：游戏体积很小，就只有10M左右，整个游戏82关，没有开始菜单，没有窗口化，直接就是第一关，弄完一关原地点鼠标，就下一关。左上角有个小圆点，点开之后，就是关声音跟上一关的按钮，很简洁，也感觉很迷茫，不知道总共多少关。
内容是跟……怎么说呢，看看商店页面的动画就差不多了，只是实际比动画要难一点这样子。背景颜色每关都换，就……很有一种令人放松的感觉吧[spoiler] （如果不追求什么通关速度）[/spoiler]
感受：总的来说，我是5块钱买的，挺值得的。玩的时候觉得，怎么还有啊，又看不到有多少关、还剩多少关的提示，就只能一直玩下去。挺考脑子的，[spoiler] 玩到第79关左右，我就忍不住去度娘看看这他妈到底有多少关了，	[/spoiler]虽然不知道度娘出来的攻略行不行，但是感觉尽量别找攻略，慢慢的试，成功了之后的成就感很强烈。
PS：打个分，因为价格并不贵，而且内容值得这个价钱，给个8分吧。[spoiler]（跟大游戏打多少分不是同一个问题，不可比较）[/spoiler]

28364172.review:
Similarly to Hook, klocki follows a very strange experience curve. It starts out with nice but very, very simple puzzles. The mechanics are creative and enjoyable, but after 10-15 minutes, when you've swept through like 35-40 levels, you start to wonder if there's any more to the game than solving the puzzles in 2 seconds and clicking through them in 10. Just when you start to feel grumpy, it turns out that you've been through a very long tutorial, and the game hits you with a puzzle that suddenly features like all the mechanics you've seen before. Difficulty is still not extreme, but the game becomes a lot of fun - and in case of klocki, it also looks very funny with everything rammed into one plate / box / whatever.

Total playtime was a bit under 1 hour, so it's a short game - still good value for 1 EUR. Recommended.

It's a line game. Which line game? All of the god damn line games!

klocki is a simple puzzle game where you basically have to complete shapes by moving around tiles that contain parts of the shapes. It's a simple concept but there are 3 different ways of moving blocks and atleast 3 different end goals to achieve and the later levels really test you by putting them together. At first, I was really bored because a simple mapping of shapes was required but it ramped up nice. I never felt stuck and overall had fun with it. I wish there were more levels, but for a dollar, I had an hour of gameplay and I'm not complaining.

The music, visuals, and animations are super nice too.

28252863.review: One of the best geometric puzzle games I've ever played. I like games that throw you into gameplay with no explanation, but allow you to figure out the "rules" by trial and error. Klocki is a very pleasant game to play, with beautiful smooth graphics in soothing colours. There are a variety of mechanisms that get introduced as you progress through the levels: rotation, swapping, etc. and it's fun to figure them out. After a new mechanism is introduced, it starts you off easy, and then begins to combine them into quite complex puzzles that are challenging but not frustrating. It's not entirely clear whether there is only one solution for each puzzle, or if you simply have to find a solution that meets the criteria, but it's fun to think about different ways you could solve it. I could play this game for hours, and was just thinking "I hope this game never ends" when it brought me back to the beginning. Aww. This game is similar to Zenge, which was equally calming and entirely too short for my liking. As with that game, I would love to see some Achievements to make the game even more replayable. For example, complete a puzzle in under X number of moves, or complete a puzzle without triggering the error buzzer, etc. Overall, this is an absolute bargain, and either a good way to kill a few hours, or a nice way to infuse your day with a few rounds of brain teasers. More! More! More!

28212065.review:
So relaxing i melted into a puddle of abstract shapes.

A charming little puzzle game for a super cheap price.
Klocki is about as simple as they come, with lovely minimalist aesthetics and a nice bit of ambiance in the background for you too. But don't be fooled - there's a decent amount of levels to keep you entertained, and the game boasts a well-implemented system of progression that'll keep you interested with new mechanics every other stage to constantly test what you've learned so far.
The only issue i really had was that it touched on the potential to be a lot more challenging but never quite got there, and the lack of any menus whatsoever meant the you were constantly in the dark about how many puzzles you've done/how many you still had to complete. But i'm nit-picking here, it's still very enjoyable, and i guess a bunch of unnecessary menus would have spoiled their smooth, super-clean look.

What's that? You haven't bought it yet? C'mon pal it's not even a quid

28120874.review:
좀 놀랐다.
게임을 시작하자마자 가운데에 판때기 2개가 놓여있고 주변에는 배경밖에 없으며 쓰는 버튼이라곤 게임 나갈 때 쓸 ESC하나 뿐.
그리고 그 2개의 판때기를 마우스로 위치를 뒤바꿔 본격적인 게임 시작.
그 박력넘치는 시작덕에 몰입도가 급상승했고, 그 영향인지 새로운 풀이법과 형태의 퍼즐이 나올 때마다 놀라움과 신비로움이라는, 마치 콜럼버스가 아메리카 대륙을 발견했을 때 느꼈을법한 감정을 느꼈다.
난이도 자체도 크게 어려운 부분이 없어 어딘가에서 너무 오랫동안 막힌 나머지 게임에 대한 몰입도가 떨어지는 일 또한 없었다.
그래픽또한 난잡하지 않고 깔끔하게 만들어져있어 퍼즐 몰입도를 높이는 데 한 몫 하였다.

중간중간 퍼즐 만들기가 귀찮았던건지 비슷한 생김새 혹은 쉬어가는 정도의 난이도의 퍼즐들이 섞여 있는데, 마치 퍼즐 갯수를 억지로 늘린 듯한 느낌이 들어 그부분은 아쉬웠다.
그리고 회전이 빠르다. 새로운 퍼즐 요소가 나오니 이전에 나왔던 퍼즐 요소 몇개가 좀 있다가 사라져버리는 것이다. 중간에 나온 6방향 회전 동그라미가 특히 그랬다. 거의 나오지도 않았다. 돌릴 때 소리하고 효과가 굉장히 박력넘치는데 안타깝다.

몰입도를 해치지 않는 단순한 그래픽과 적당한 난이도. 퍼즐의 여러가지 개성넘치는 형태와 풀이법. …박력넘치는 게임 시작?!?!
이 세상에 단점없는 것은 없다. 이 게임은 충분히 추천할 가치가 있다.

Pros:
- Challenging enough puzzles, yet easy enough for casuals.
- It introduces new mechanics often enough to prevent monotony.
- The price is very low.
- Roughly an hour of fun or less, depending on how clever you are.

Cons:
- The last puzzle is disappointingly easy compared to the puzzle that preceded it.
- There is no congratulatory message after solving the last puzzle, just an abrupt return to the first puzzle.
- No Steam cards nor achievements. (no big deal for me, but some folks might want to know)
- The only way to exit the game is to press ESC, but it doesn't tell you that. (again, no big deal for me. But still...)

Overall: It's an impulse buy, and a good one.

27591050.review:
[b]Warning: this game is below 30mins.[/b]

This is extremely good sliding puzzler with a lot of great mechanics. Mostly amazing graphics (the type of things from the last level should be smoother when combined). This great rewarding inception sound. And great level-design based tutorialization, without obnoxious explicit arrows, animations and texts.

The main problem is — small levels, which are very easy, and there are not much of them. You can blitz the game in less than half of an hour. Well it costs slightly more than one loaf of bread (in our local pricing), and 30% of that money goes to the valve's pocket. By itself these several minutes of gameplay were worth the price. But if we consider the current meta, where you can buy for the same amount of money old full AAA release (or two) [like, for example, two great Commandos games], then this seems extremely expensive.
Also it doesn't have an ending, just like in old arcades — if you won it instantly starts over without warning.

So, before purchase, you should estimate how much you like tile sliding\switching\rotating puzzlers and just how cheap are you.

26992106.review:
In a market where games are often expected to highly dynamic, Klocki is simple. Its a wonderful puzzle game that is highly engaging. It takes the player back to a basic fundamental aspect of life, that being curiosity. All levels build upon past mechanics that are presented in a simple and elegant manner. The best part is how these mechanics are first introduced to players. No rules, no prompts, no timers, just you and a puzzle. Touch an element and it immediately reacts to that stimuli.

I use Klocki as an example at the studio I work at to illustrate how simple a mechanic can be, yet be used so carefully that it becomes something amazing.

Klocki has given me more enjoyment than several AAA $60 titles. It's not that difficult though some puzzles may require you to close the game and give it a little rest before attempting to solve them again, because there was some obvious detail you might have missed. The pacing is near perfect, and new elements are introduced to you very smoothly, so you're always ready to take on whatever lies ahead. For its price, it's a steal.

这款游戏的主题就是“简”。整个游戏没有任何的说明，全部的解密方式得靠自己摸索。但所有的解密元素又合情合理，毫不突兀。极简的背景音乐、极简的画风，能让抛开一切，专心解密。

Hay algo mágico en esa satisfacción, en ese momento eureka que nos hace clic en la cabeza cada vez que resolvemos algún puzzle, ya sea en una aventura gráfica, ya sea en un juego a la sazón puro y duro, cual [i]The Witness[/i]. Es ese momento en el que trascendemos un poco de lo que tenemos delante y lo apreciamos por fin en su esencia, y como cuando Neo aprende kung-fú después de haber recibido más hostias que panes, nos sabemos mejores que antes con la lección aprendida y empezamos a resolver incógnitas visuales una detrás de otra, pim pam, hasta que una variación de la mecánica, o quizás una totalmente distinta, nos vuelve a llevar al punto de partida de La Ignorancia. Y vuelta a la búsqueda de ese pequeño orgasmito mental.

[i]Klocki[/i] es un juego de puzzles que da todo eso en un asequible formato light de aproximadamente hora y media y por apenas un euro.

Si eso no es calidad/precio en su máximo esplendor, yo ya no sé qué puede serlo.

25933284.review:
What a pleasant little puzzler!    

The aim of the game is to complete lines or loops, where they can be wiggly across one surface, or wrap over corners to cover the faces of a cube.  It's all presented in isometric, with no need to rotate the whole play-space to get use of the three dimensions. It's really nicely done.   It doesn't use the isometric playfulness of "Monument Valley", for instance.  It just uses the flatter perspective to keep the game clean and puzzle-like.

The puzzles start out really simple, and stay very simple for the first dozen levels.   Every so often a new play device is thrown in, but usually it's pretty obvious what to do with it... There's one thing "the hourglasses", which occur, and it can be a little bit of a headscratcher, but after a bit of experimenting, that turns out to be one of the funner devices in the game.

I had a lovely time playing it on a plane, and then just in the evening once everyone had gone to bed to while away the last hour of the day. Each 'level' can take between 4 seconds and several minutes.  The sliding-block puzzles can take a couple of goes at them to get the right sequence, but none of them are particularly difficult.

Very short, very easy, and very satisfying.    I can only imagine there'll be a Klocki 2 with far more interesting devices at some point, because this feels like a perfectly-formed well-made demonstration of the genre that's a wonderful game in itself.  Well recommended for a quid!

I didn't have the best initial impression of Klocki - I tried a couple of levels quickly when I bought it and didn't have time to get into the relaxed vibe - and on returning to it this evening to play a little more discovering that there was no level selection screen (a victory of form over function of its minimalist aesthetic). However, the puzzle design is good, if not challenging - everything is fairly intuitive and well-presented - and the sound design is fitting, and as new mechanics were introduced an interested little "ooh!" escaped me a couple of times. I would like to see some sort of interface for level selection or way of telling how far through you are - hell, I'm a junkie for Steam achievements so a little positive feedback would be good for me - but I think that my latter preferences are at odds with what the game actually offers - an almost aimless wander through a few relaxing puzzles, instead of rushing through to hit targets or complete the game or whatever other things I do which stop me from switching off and smelling the roses.

I'm not saying it will permanently change the way I play games, of course, but it is a nice experience.

Also, it's hella cheap.

Für nicht ganz einen Euro wurde ich mit klocki nicht ganz eine Stunde gut unterhalten. Die minimalistischen Grafiken sind schick. Die Rätsel logisch und die wechselnden Rätselelemente halten das Spiel interessant. Wenn man das Spiel unterbrickt wird automatisch gespeichert. Nachdem das letzte Rästel gelöst ist beginnt das Spiel dann automatisch von vorn.

Leider gibt es für die zweite Runde weder einen Shuffle-Modus (alle Rätsel wild durcheinander) noch neue Herrausforderungen. Alles in allem ist klocki ein nettes kleines Spiel, dass durch die Ambient-Musik angenehm entspannt während die Rätsel komplexter aber nie unlösbar oder unfair werden.

Der Wiederspielwert ist eher gering, falls nicht - wie schon einmal geschehen - neue Rätsel nachgereicht werden.

Bought this to to have it in my steam library (I have a game buying additiction). :)

I have a lot of games in my library that I never played or had time to get into, but I always at least launch them to see if anything about it "grabs" me right away. klocki was one of those games. 

I don't write many reviews, but I felt that I should take the time to write about how this game is simply an absolutely amazing value at a dollar. I love puzzles as I am a software analyst for a living and debug stuff all the time, so I have an a predisposition to liking puzzle games. Most of them are all just bland though. I felt the urge to keep playing through klocki until I could no more. The puzzles get processively more difficult (as you would expect), and I enjoyed moving onto each "step" as it came. I wish there could be a ton more levels to play through, but at a dollar, there really isn't much room to complain about length. 

The simplicity is one of it's best traits. It's a simple, clean, and calm game. Definately worth the price.

25769918.review:
Look, it's a fairly well-done puzzle game, and it's a buck. I don't think its the best puzzle game out there, but it is a far cry from the worst.

[b][i]klocki[/i] brings several puzzle mechanisms to the table, which can at times make it feel like the B-Side outtakes of a larger, more successful, think tank project.[/b] The one thing I'll really fault it for is that it really doesn't take too much forethought or thinking ahead to solve the puzzles. You just play around with a loose plan in your head, and you will almost always get there.

I value puzzle games that require no guessing, and reward (enforce, actually) a pure logic think-it-through approach (ie. [i]Hexcells[/i]). While there are much worse offenders out there, this is probably where I'd say [i]klocki[/i] loses out from being really brilliant.

Like many modern puzzlers, [i]klocki[/i] has a minimalistic interface and design approach, which is nice. It is on mobile too.

[b]Honestly, I wouldn't pay full price for this - there is about 1.5 hours of content and it is bound to drop in price at some point - OR get it on mobile since it is probably better with touch controls anyway.[/b]

25638510.review:
23 actual puzzles with 58 tutorials. I don't mean easy puzzles. I mean can't-miss exercises in trial & error. I'm pretty mediocre at puzzle games, and for me this all worked out to roughly one puzzle per minute, despite the fact that I'm easily confused by the sort of sliding-block stuff that appears later in the game.

The problem here is not that klocki isn't full of good ideas, or even that the puzzles are dumb. The problem is that this game spends nearly all its time introducing its elements, a little time combining some of them, and almost no time using all or even many of them at once.

For a comparison let's look at Blockwick 2, where the completion time for many reviewers looks like about 6 minutes per puzzle. Given my experience with Keifer Bros games I'd say this is about right. An unfair comparison, since Blockwick 2 is the work of a veteran three-man studio, but here's the thing. Klocki is more interesting, more original, and sometimes more clever. What went wrong here is that the sum of the parts never adds up to more than the sum of the parts.

Just when I felt like I was finally getting to the good stuff, the game ended.

Easily worth a dollar, but probably not worth the hour you'll spend nodding at the screen and waiting for a challenge.

완료까지의 플레이타임: 약 40~50분

상당히 간단한 퍼즐들의 모음입니다. 미니멀리즘을 지향한 만큼 단순하고 깔끔한 그래픽과 배경음악. 그 중에서도 퍼즐 자체에 집중한 모습을 보여줍니다. 여러 장치들이 등장해서 복잡할 수 있겠다 생각했지만, 새로운 요소가 등장하면 기초적인 수순부터 밟게 해주어 아주 쉽게 알아차릴 수 있었네요. 적지 않은 수의 룰 설명 없이 실전으로 던져버리는 잔혹한 퍼즐게임과는 살짝 대조됩니다.

한가지 아쉬운점이 있다면 스테이지의 수가 많지 않아 역시 플탐이 매우 짧다는 것... 장치들을 적극 활용한 난이도 높은 퍼즐들이라거나가 수록되었으면 좋았을텐데, 가열하다 만 미적지근한 난이도라 아쉬움에 입맛을 다실 수 밖에 없었습니다.

25505045.review:
[h1]Klocki
6/10[/h1]
[b]Przyjemna, prosta gra logiczna.[/b]
Gra zajmuje godzinkę, lub dwie. Nie wiem ile zawiera plansz, nie ma żadnego menu poziomów, po ukończeniu ostatniego gra po prostu zapętla się i wyskakuje pierwszy poziom, co trochę słabo wg. mnie wygląda. Gra ma prostą przyjemną grafikę, jak i dźwięk, choć po jakimś czasie i tak włączyłem swoją muzykę. 
Trudność gry jest niewielka, plansze mają poziom od kompletnie banalnego, do średniego, w tych najtrudniejszych musiałem parę minut pomyśleć. Rozgrywka sprowadza się do zmieniania położenia i obracania elementów planszy tak, by utworzyły wymagany wzór. W tych trudniejszych planszach chodzi o nadanie priorytetów konkretnym ustawieniom. Najpierw wykluczamy pewne ustawienia danych klocków, a potem inne ustawiamy tak, by pasowały do wcześniej podjętych kroków. Moim zdaniem autor nie wykorzystał odpowiednio potencjału takiej mechaniki rozgrywki i nie stworzył trudnych, rozbudowanych poziomów.
Zapiona bez obniżki za 1 euro - uczciwa cena za taki produkt.

25504060.review:
Fantastic puzzle game with an enjoyable concept and wonderfully minimalist graphics to fit the overall feel of the game. Klocki does an amazing job showing you how to play through the gameplay alone without any text or instructions at all; it encourages you to experiment and play with the objects given to you to see how each item functions, and once you get a feel for it it's a smooth ride through a slew of challenging and fun puzzles. The ambience is relaxing, and the sound effects are fun and fit the tone of the game well. The only thing it's really lacking is some kind of options menu that at the very least allows you to toggle between Fullscreen and Windowed.

Overall Klocki is super enjoyable and proves to be very accessible to any level of players.

Bardzo wciągająca, relaksująca gra logiczna.
Grafika jest bardzo ładna, minimalistyczna. Świetne, ambientowe udźwiękowienie pomaga w skupieniu się i "wczuciu" w grę.
Niestety jest stosunkowo krótka. I prosta - słabo gram w tego typu produkcje, a przeszedłem ją w dwa wieczory. Z drugiej strony nie chodzi tu o wielogodzinne główkowanie, ale o klimat i relaks. W dodatku wiele różnych mechanik (na dobrą sprawę każdą można by zamknąć w osobnej grze) nie pozwala się nudzić. Nieco rozczarowuje również zakończenie - przechodzimy po prostu ponownie do pierwszego poziomu. Problemem jest również nierozdzielenie "sejwów" między lokalnymi kontami.
Grę bardzo mocno polecam. Doświadczenie jest wspaniałe, niemal oniryczne :P Cena jak najbardziej rozsądna, a w dodatku jest to polska produkcja. Czekam na więcej, na pewno kupię, coby autor miał za co kupić piwko

25358328.review:
[url=https://cowlevel.net/game/klocki/review/1895970][b]转载自奶牛关的个人评测[/b][/url]

这是一款适合6-12岁的益智游戏。（换言之就是适合小学生的游戏）

难度不高，通过j几种基本的拼图移动方式，如交换，平移，旋转等方式，将直线或同色快图连接在一起。从一开始最简单的平面，到三视图的立体面，到多面。基本上增加难度的方式无法是增加拼图的基本块数和增加更多的面。

通关流程基本在一个半小时左右（上下误差在30分钟）。没卡！没成就！亮点大概就在配色，越到后面加入越来越多的颜色，但依旧不会感到不适。

噢，对了，音乐没听，主要是这类音乐个人不是很感兴趣...

25355918.review: This is a great puzzle game. I do not know if you will decide that about an hours worth of game time is worth a dollar. Saying that, this is one of my favorite puzzle games I have played in recent times. The controls are super intuitive. There is no tutorial or way to show the controls. It's not needed. There were only a few parts that I could not grasp immediately, however, with a little fiddling around, you should be able to easily figure out how to play each level (although figuring out how to beat each level is a different story). All in all, I recommend this game and would rate it 4/5. The only thing lacking is the amount of levels. I would love to see a continuation/more levels added.

25347291.review: Klocki is a minimalistic modern puzzle game that is somewhat addicting the first time you start it up. The levels will obviously get harder, but as they get harder, the ways you move the pieces of the puzzle will change. Clicking to sliding to rotating, you name it. Klocki is something to play when you have a little time to burn before going out or if you're waiting for something to render or export. It's very lightweight and easy for everyone to play. You can be the game in no time at all, so I hope in the near future the devs will create perhaps a workshop for the game so that the players themselves can create levels and have more diversity and challenge added to the game. For only a mere $1, this game is something to drop your last dollar in your Steam wallet on!

25301258.review:
I really enjoy unique little puzzle games and this one is a nice addition to the library. It’s quite short, as it took me just over an hour to complete, but it was still quite enjoyable in my opinion. 

It plays with various mechanics to mix the game up a little and make it a little more challenging. It also does a good job of introducing each new mechanic gently before incorporating it into all the others and giving you harder puzzles to solve. 

Difficulty wise, I would say that it’s not at the “mind-boggling” level, so you won’t have to think too hard about it. But with that said it’s not too easy either. It’s kind of a middle ground that I would say still left me satisfied enough to have liked the game. 

The graphics are simple and nice on the eyes, which gives the game a chill kind of feeling despite the fact that some puzzles towards the end look a little visually chaotic.

This game came after the developer’s previous puzzle game “Hook” which is another unique short little puzzle game that I quite enjoyed. If you have played and enjoyed that I think you would enjoy this one too, and vice versa to people that have played this and might enjoy that.

I look forward to any other little puzzle games that this developer comes out with and would say it’s definitely worth spending an hour on for under £1. 

EDIT: The dev added in an achievement after I had finished it for completing the game, I re-installed the game ready to go through it again and was pleasantly surprised to know that despite it saying that it’s not on the cloud, it had saved that I had already completed it. As you can scroll left and right through the levels and it was where I left it last time, I automatically got the achievement. So an easy 100% if you haven’t played the game, but an even easier 100% if you have.


TL;DR : It’s an interesting and unique little puzzle game that is quite short but enjoyable over all.

25215758.review:
I'm a rabid Linux user and it takes a lot of enticement to drag me kicking and screaming into Windows, but I love puzzle games and klocki's incredible review scores were too tempting to resist.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]

I was expecting harder puzzles - maybe not hardcore but the screenshots looked like they had some challenge in them at least - but I was surprised to find such easy gameplay. A few levels put up a couple of extra minutes' resistance but most I just sped straight through non-stop.

[h1]Pro[/h1]

It's a pretty, casual puzzler to spend a couple of hours with. I did enjoy the time.

[h1]Cons[/h1]

No level overview, no names/numbers for the levels. You can't tell how far you've progressed in the game. It turns out there are 82 levels but you have no idea during gameplay, you just carry on and then suddenly find yourself on level 1 again. Game over.

Windows only. I know I'm harping on about this, but how hard would it be to port such a simple game over to Linux, really?

[h1]Value[/h1]

Being a $1 game doesn't automatically make it brilliant value. You have to consider the amount of gameplay and compare it with other games. I'd say $1 is correct for this game but not outstanding. You have to bear in mind there are a bazillion other $1 2-hour games, most of which have trading cards so you can get half your money back.

[h1]Steam[/h1]

No achievements. No cards.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

I confess I had pre-conceived high expectations for this game but it didn't live up to the hype. It's a perfectly nice short puzzler and deserves a recommendation but it's forgettable and I've had better. Examples? OK then:

Zenge is the same price/length/difficulty but it's prettier, has better music, trading cards, an achievement and Linux; Meld costs more but has 50 times the gameplay (time-wise) with difficulty from easy to hardcore++, making it far better value.

Go on then, downvote me. You needed a reality check amongst all the enthusiasm though. You know it.

[quote]This review is part of the Steamified Community Review program. For similar reviews and fantastic giveaways please visit http://steamified.com.[/quote]

25211113.review:
klocki is just soo relaxing. The music, the sound effects, the colors, the designs, everything in it seems to work together to put you in the best setting for an aesthetically satisfying past-time.

This isn't a game for people who like hardcore puzzle action: it's short, it's easy, and there aren't any levels in which you'll find yourself stuck. That being said, I think it's much more of an experience than a puzzle game per se (for those who read "puzzle" and instantly think of brain-bugging, thought intensive, difficult games). I once rage quit on another game, so I opened up klocki and it was the best thing I could have done. It doesn't really present you challenges, but I took my sweet time with it (I played it for only a few minutes per day and it took me exactly 2 hours total to go once through all the levels) and oh, did I enjoy it.

I also think the price is just fine, and would even argue it's cheap for everything you get, especially if there were more levels (which I find to be the only downside). You're not paying for a challenge here, you pay for the beautiful design and atmosphere enveloping the rotating, swapping, sliding tranquility of it.

之前在手机上搜索解谜类游戏的时候，免费玩了个爽。刚才在steam上再次看到它，没有任何折扣，但是我毫不犹豫地买了下来。
因为这款游戏实在是太有趣了！六块钱物超所值！请务必喜加一！
简洁可爱的画面，有趣多变的谜题，轻松舒心的BGM。没有冗杂的文字解说，清新无比，好单纯好不做作，和外面那群妖艳贝戈货一点都不一样。
这是我第一次在steam平台上撰写评测，因为我刚刚购入了个人电脑。希望我的库存数量不会影响我语言的可信度。
我想说这个游戏非常值得去买，在手机上我花费了70分钟左右通关，体感五分。

25047963.review:
Clean, minimalistic and elegant design. At first it appears too simple and hackneyed, but I'm glad as I stayed with it, as it quickly introduced puzzle variations that kept it interesting and engaging till the end -- to the point I was disappointed it was over and went looking for more levels. 

The puzzle designs feel a bit amateurish -- in that there isn't a consistency to the difficulty ramp (it can jump from easy to hard to easy), and some of the innovative puzzle mechanisms aren't employed to their potential (e.g. the brilliant dominoes mechanism isn't used beyond a couple of puzzles). And I say that not as much as criticism, but rather as feedback to encourage the devs to focus there for future games, as they've done a remarkable job in most other aspects. 

It is a short game, but very appropriately priced for 99c. I'm a cheapskate and yet I felt it was absolutely worth buying, not just for the game experiece, but also to encourage the developers to continue down this path -- you guys hold much promise. Good luck!
