24942185.review: Combines puzzle idea from games like the sliding puzzle, Peg Solitaire, Tsuro, Loops of Zen and others into a whole new kind of challenge. Some of the solutions blew my mind when I uncovered them. More importantly, the game keeps throwing new ideas and challenges at you, and combines the different puzzle types into fiendishly complex little tasks that are rewarding to complete. This experience is worth far more than the asking price of $1.

24939749.review:
Following the author's last puzzle game, "Hook", Klocki is another great relaxing and minimalistic puzzle game.

The concept this time twirls around swapping and rotating tiles to complete one or more paths inside geometrical figures, the difficulty curve is perfect, sometimes challenging but never frustrating, and it's one of those games that (being only around 1 hour long) makes you finish it in a single breath; not to mention the AMAZING background music and sound effects, relax is granted.

Being priced at 0.99€ you simply have no reasons not to buy it, the only cons I can find are that  there's no end-game screen, you are just warped back to the first level (but you get the achievement for completing all levels) and the game itself being a bit short, some extra levels would be good.

[h1] 7.5/10 [/h1]
Maciej Targoni doesn't disappoint and confirms to be able of creating amazing and relaxing puzzle games, indeed they are short but being priced so low there's no reason not to buy it.

24911878.review: klocki ist ein wirklich tolles Rätselspiel und kann es nur weiterempfehlen. Das Ziel ist bei jedem Level zwar das gleiche, aber wie man dazu kommt ist eine andere Frage. Je nach Rätsel hat man verschiedene Mechaniken das Ziel zu erreichen. Die Rätsel beginnen ganz einfach, steigern sich von Level zu Level in der Schwierigkeit und dann wird eine neue Mechnik eingeführt. Im Laufe des Spiels werden dann diese verschiedenen Mechaniken kombiniert und so bietet dieses Spiel eine Fülle an verschiedenen Rätsel, die aber trotzdem nicht langweilig werden. Ich hoffe, dass der/die Entwickler bald einige Rätsel hinzufügen werden, denn es könnten gerne noch ein paar mehr sein ;)

24820146.review:
~9/10~
Really soothing, and addicting if you think you are good at puzzles. The early stages prepare you for the later stages. every few levels it introduces a new mechanic so it doesnt get boring fast.

I personally am more of a fan of spacial puzzles rather than number puzzles. I also enjoy solving "rubik's" cubes, 4x4's and the megaminx. This is a great "app" type game and works well with a mouse. 

The music is great too. Totally worth 99 cents if you want something to waste an hour on in your down time. I give this a 9/10, because there was no level counter, which could have been left out for asthetic purposes, but is still a feature i value in a level based game. :)

Первый раз пишу обзор на такую дешевую и простую игрушку, но к счастью, он будет положительным. Klocki - замечательная, дешевая, но качественно сделанная головоломка с приятной минималистичной графикой, неплохим звуковым сопровождением.

  Игра проходится довольно быстро, но от этого проще не становится (материла все и вся, когда начались пятнашки). Также есть разные механики, что тоже делает головоломки наиболее интересными. + периодически добавляются уровни. Короче, эта штука стоит ваших 30 рублей.

[i]Личная оценка - 10/10.[/i]

It's a fun and fairly challenging puzzle game that finds the middle point between frustratingly hard and boastingly easy.

+ Casual af

24727871.review:
Worth much more than $1.

70 minutes in,  and I must say that I am impressed. I didn't expect the game to last more than 20 levels or so, nor to be so rich in the amount of puzzle types you encounter.

The difficulty increases constantly with the introduction of new puzzle dynamics which work wonderfully together and increase the scope of thought you need to process and complete these puzzles.

That being said, the difficulty till now hasn't felt frustrating or tiring in any way.

I would recommend this game for $10 till this point. If it continues to bring more and more puzzles from this point, I would even recommend it for $20.

The game costs $1. What the hell are you contemplating? Buy it!

[b]I bought the game for 0.89€ at a 10% discount (original price: 0.99€ / $0.99).[/b]

[h1]TL;DR:[/h1] If you don't want to read the whole review, check out the last paragraph with the summary. ("To sum up, [...]")

[i]Klocki[/i] did everything right what [i]Hook[/i] has done wrong in my eyes.

Even though [i]Hook[/i] was and is still very successful and popular, it always felt monotonous and too easy; it simply bored me despite its elegant concept. [i]Klocki[/i], however, introduces two important changes to such an elegant puzzle concept – diversity and challenge.

There are various gameplay mechanics all going very well together. The general goal is to move tiles to achieve a closed circuit. 
Moving the tiles is done by either swapping two tiles on a grid, rotating them, rotating several tiles at once or by sliding them to empty places. Given the available moving mechanics, you have to figure out how to correctly arrange the present tiles. 
These tiles can be black squares who mustn't touch each other, red or yellow wires who have to be connected and red or green areas who have to be connected as well. All of those might also be immovable, which adds another great gameplay element. 
Another important aspect to mention is that you can't just move all tiles where you wan't them to be. There are "grids" based on the perspective of the level which show you which tiles are interchangeable.

[i]Klocki[/i] offers many levels and I needed about 45 minutes to complete all of them. These levels begin very simple and slowly introduce new concepts leading to more complex levels. The complexity is never too high, but high enough to maintain a small challenge (in contrast to [i]Hook[/i], where there was no challenge at all for me). This way, you will consistently enjoy it (provided that you don't always need brain-twisting puzzles) and have a relaxing experience.

Aside from the gameplay, the visuals are very great, albeit not everyone's taste, with a colorful and minimalist design.

To sum up, [i]Klocki[/i] is a beautiful and fun game which offers a relaxing experience for unfortunately only a short time of about an hour. In spite of the rather short playtime, I wholeheartedly recommend [i]Klocki[/i] considering the affordable price of $0.99.

24684712.review:
偶然在Steam上逛到这款游戏，一看到它良心的价格以及27国的语言，我连评价都未瞄一眼，便毫不犹豫购买了。买后，我并不希望这6元只是“喜+1”，于是屁颠屁颠跑去下载、试玩。

打开游戏，我立即被这款游戏震惊到了，这款游戏极度小清新！论简洁的程度真的是数一数二。此刻，我也瞬间顿悟有27国语言的游戏为什么能只要6元，因为他喵了个咪整个游戏，一个字都没有，打开直接游戏，没有开始菜单。游戏中，只有左上角一个圆点，是“设置”按钮。点开设置，圆点小时，取而代之的是右上角出现了一个小喇叭，点击一下静音，再点一下声音恢复；左下角和右下角出现了两个箭头（如果你一关都没玩过可能两个箭头都没有），分别用于选上一关和下一关，如果你没玩过的关是不能选的；点击空白处退出设置，熟悉的小圆点回来了。“Esc”键直接退出，不怕死可以尝试上班玩玩。

这款游戏融合了水管工、魔方等多种元素，玩法多样，益智烧脑；画风清爽明快，男女老少皆可爽玩；流程虽短，价格绝对良心。

游戏界面是挺小清新的，而且还有很多元素我也知道了，但是，没！有！提！示！所以各位蠢萌的孩子就可怜了。还有就是，背景音乐虽然耐听，调小音量更耐听，但翻来覆去就这首，还是未免有些单调的，虽然高智商的人早就在听腻之前通关了。嗯，正好说说通关时间，据说有20分钟的大神？总之，智障小编玩了一个半小时，不过我是一遍弄懂玩法的，可喜可贺可喜可贺。其实刚通关我都不知道我通关了，因为它直接跳回了第一关。可以，这很霸道。

总的来说，6元，绝对超值。

——来自MightyGod的ShalomWang

24647274.review:
The thing I like about this game is that there is very little random guessing involved. Whoever designed the levels was [b]really[/b] good at dropping hints on which piece to start with. It's very similar to a jigsaw puzzle; as long as you can figure out which pieces are basically corner pieces, you won't have to blindly guess.

A lot of other puzzle games have a bit of luck involved; if you had bad luck in the beginning and started with the wrong piece in the wrong orientation, you might not realize it until you've sunk a lot of time into the puzzle. In the worst cases, you'd have to restart, leading to a lot of frustration. In klocki, it's relatively easy to figure out which piece (or group of pieces) is the "right" piece to start with. There are plenty of hints, as long as you look carefully.

There's also a large variety of mechanics, such as switching pieces, sliding, or rotating. It is [u]not[/u] doing the same puzzle but bigger/more complex/more frustrating over and over again.

It crashed once for me, but luckily it autosaved (I'm assuming every level, or even every move?). Stability doesn't seem to be an issue.

The only complaint is that it's very short, but it's definitely longer than I expected for $0.99, and defintiely worth the money. I'm almost hoping for something like a level editor, except I doubt most people will be as good as the dev at making the levels.

24637225.review:
Klucz do gry dostarczył mi jej twórca.

Klocki to gra logiczna, polegająca na przesuwaniu lub obracaniu tytułowych klocków w taki sposób, aby ścieżki narysowane na nich, łączyły się ze sobą. W grze zastosowano wiele ciekawych mechanik, które są stopniowo wprowadzane do kolejnych poziomów. Są zwykłe klocki, które możemy zamieniać ze sobą miejscami, są takie, które można obracać, są takie, które można przesunąć tylko o jedno pole, czy też takie, które nie mogą się ze sobą stykać. W grze są nawet dźwignie, które obracają kilka klocków naraz. Nie można narzekać na monotonność.

Przejście pierwszych zagadek zajmuje dosłownie paręnaście sekund, ale poziom trudności z czasem wzrasta i wtedy możemy się trochę pogłowić. Mimo to, nie ma tutaj mowy o zacięciu się. Zagadki są proste, ale jednocześnie satysfakcjonujące.

Do grafiki też nie można się przyczepić. Jest ona kolorowa i minimalistyczna, przez co wszystko jest dobrze widoczne. Na dodatek w tle przygrywa nam relaksujący ambient, co bardzo umila rozgrywkę. Jedyna rzecz do której mogę się przyczepić to brak numeracji poziomów.

Podsumowując: Gra kosztuje dosłownie parę złotych, a zapewnia sporo rozrywki. Przejście wszystkich 82 poziomów zajęło mi nieco ponad godzinę, co jest sprawiedliwą długością w stosunku do ceny. Klocki z całą pewnością warto kupić, tym bardziej, że są polskie.

24597569.review:
Klocki is a very simple puzzle game with basic puzzle mechanics. There isn't much i can say about the game. The mechanics are well made, the soundtrack is good and the game teaches the mechanics in a simple and understandable way without telling you directly.

The biggest problem with the game is the difficulty. The mechanics in the game are well made and with some time and effort harder levels could have been made. What i see in this game is wasted potential. I never really got stuck in the game and i would even pay more for the game if i would get some more challenging levels.

And since i'm talking about difficulty let me explain why the game is easy. It's very predictable where some pieces should go or how they should be turned. This way it's easy to place tha mayority, if not all pieces. Then you are left with 1 to 6 pieces. And the moment this predictability was gone the game was near it's end.

Also i have seen some very minor problems. Their influence on the quality is almost insignificant but the fixing them would be easy.
[list]
[*]The only way to find a level is by navigating trough them 1 by 1 using a pair of arrows. A small menu would be usefull
[*]After finishing the game you loop around, when this happened to me i thought the game was ending with some kind of alteration of the start. So i kept going for some levels thinking something was going to happen
[*]The slide puzzles can only slide one at the time, which is annoying.
[*]An option for windowed mode. The game went on my second monitor(which has a pretty bad resolution). I used alt + enter to move it to the other screen but not everybody knows this.
[/list]

That said this game is only €0,99 which is a pretty good deal.
for that reason i recommend it if you even have the slightest intrest in these kind of puzzles.

Este juego me ha cambiado la vida, gracias a él veo los problemas cotidianos de otra manera. Su mensaje y lore encriptado en medio de tanto bloque y puzzle se clavan en mi cabeza. Este juego lleva un mensaje demasiado poderoso para el 78,56% de la sociedad, el mundo no está preparado aún para el Klocki.
Insisto, el Klocki no es exactamente un juego, Klocki es una nueva forma de ver la vida, un viaje que no te dejará indiferente pasando por los más sencillos puzzles hasta llegar a los confines de la complejidad.
Si bien es cierto que este juego es más adecuado para móvil o tablet que para escritorio, es un punto positivo poder gozar de él en total plenitud en todos estos formatos, lo cuál ayuda a difundir el mensaje del Klocki.

24575103.review:
Unlike developers game "Hook", klocki could  be somehow called complex vision puzzle games.
Why did I described it as vision puzzle? Because you actually need to see possible paterns that could be used on certain levels. Some levels are quite easy, you look at them and after 3 to 5 clicks, they're done.
While some other levels get tricky and although you seem to know how to deal with it, it will confuse you. 
When you think it is impossible to do it, you will actually see how to deal with the problem the other way around.
This game has quite great level pool, so it takes some time to finish them all, but believe me, you will be satisfied when you're done with it.

Pros
-Great game for the buck
-Big level pull
-Your brain actually need to work here
-Great for kids to develop some skills
Cons
-No trading cards

Overall I will give this game 9/10 because, even though I really enjoyed it, I would like to see Steam Trading Cards.

24566863.review:
Klocki is a puzzle game with a simple idea: Get all the lines and/or shapes to end without coming to a sudden stop. There were no words in the entire game so you have to figure out everything by yourself, but that adds to the novelty. It took me about an hour and a half to beat.
Pros:
•Very simple to understand.
•Slowly introduces new concepts so you don’t have to try to memorize all the ideas at once.
•Not frustratingly difficult, but it still makes you think.
•Not at all expensive.
•Tremendously fun!
Cons:
•No title screen or easy way to pick a specific level.
•Too short.
Overall:
I thoroughly enjoyed the Klocki, and my mom says that she liked the few minutes she spent playing it. However, when I clicked to move to the next level and it went to the very first level I was a bit disappointed. But since the game was only $0.99 I should not be complaining.
9/10

24519893.review:
This game is incredible. From the simplicity of its UI to the wonderfully low price, everything about it is pleasing. It does something that I think is indescribably unique and valuable for a puzzle game -- it switches things up. Often, when the difficulty of a puzzle game like this one increases, you get increasingly difficult puzzles of the same type over and over again. It gets to the point where the puzzle is so complex and you don't even feel like solving it because it just seems like busy work. 

THIS GAME DOES NOT DO THAT! What a pleasure it is to put in a solid 10 minutes to solve a puzzle, and then be rewarded with something totally new to learn instead of just a more annoying version of the thing you just completed. Don't get me wrong, you WILL get more difficult versions of the same puzzle, but not for more than a few puzzles in a row. I think a lot of games could learn from this. It keeps things fresh and fun and will make you want to keep coming back to excercise your brain.

24489652.review:
Juego de puzles muy divertido.

Se nos presentan varias mecánicas con las que jugar, bien del tipo arrastrar piezas, cambiar unas por otras, girarlas respecto a un eje y demás. Tras esto, varios niveles nos enseñan a usarlas y jugar con ellas y luego aumenta la dificultad de los puzles. Una vez dominas varias mecánicas te las mezclan entre sí y los últimos niveles sin llegar a tener una dificultad extremadamente alta, te hacen pensar un momento cómo meterle mano al asunto.

Tras esto, el juego no tiene mucho más, una interfaz muy limpia (De hecho está prácticamente vacía), sin música más allá de un par de sonidos durante el juego y otro al terminar el nivel.

Me ha durado unos 50-60 minutos el completarlo, podríais pensar que podría optar por pedir un reembolso ya que me lo he pasado en menos de las dos horas que estipula Steam, pero al valer poco menos de un euro y haberme divertido durante aproximadamente una hora (Cosa que no todos los AAA del mercado han conseguido conmigo) creo que el autor bien lo merece.

Por último y a modo de recomendación, si lo jugáis y os gusta, el autor también tiene otro juego llamado "Hook", muy similar en el sentido de puzles únicamente, e igual de barato y entretenido.

Klocki - головоломка в стиле "минимализм".

Отличнейшая головоломка в моем любимом стиле, "минимализм", где нет ничего лишнего, тут даже по сути нет меню игры, открывая игру Вы сразу же начинаете играть. Как и во всех других головоломках первые уровни легкие, а потом сложность постепенно увеличивается и Вам все больше нужно напрягать свой мозг. Я прошел довольно далеко и не встретил сложностей, по сему думаю что игра не сложная. Неплохое музыкальное сопровождение, но если вдруг оно Вам надоест, его всегда можно отключить. Так же если Вы захотите перепройти игру или какой-либо уровень, у Вас есть такая возможность, Вы всегда можете вернуться в самое начало игры либо же на любой другой пройденный Вами ранее уровень.

Отличная игра за свои деньги, простая головоломка, ничего лишнего. Для любителей такого жанра самое то.

24454109.review:
Just. Add. Water.

Klocki is without a shadow of a doubt one of the biggest bargains on Steam right now. It also happens to be one of the most intuitive, well designed and almost flawless puzzle games on Steam. The sheer brilliance of the game cannot be underestimated. It may appear simple and that's because it is but it will have you engrossed from beginning to end.

[h1]Highlights[/h1]

The highlights of the game are its intuitiveness, accessibility, the design of the puzzles and the color palette. 

First, the game rests upon its control scheme. The game plays fluidly and it is played very intuitively. Most players will find themselves completely at ease from the get go. As a result you will not need to fiddle around to work things out.  Just load the game and play.

Secondly, the game is accessible to everyone. This is a rare game that I can envision every one gaining something out of. As the game requires just a mouse to play it is a game that abled gamers should be very happy to play. The logic behind the puzzles is something that will strengthen the mind of gamers young and old. 

Thirdly, the puzzles have been developed with logic firmly in mind. Therefore, the only time that the puzzles should take you some time to work out are those in which your own logic is puzzled. There will never be a time when you play the game and question its fairness or wonder why a puzzle is intended to work one way but works in a completely different manner. As a result this automatically has the game pushing towards the front of the pack.

Finally, but certainly no means least I was a huge fan of the color palette. I found that the color palette is super easy on the eyes. As a result, I find that I can play for extended periods of time without my eyes becoming sore. Given the quality of the puzzles this is a very sizable strength.

[h1]So Nearly Flawless[/h1]

As I said the game is almost flawless. There are a few minor complaints that I have with the game. 

First, arguably the biggest flaw is that the presentation is so minimal that there is no proper menu system within the game. As a result players are unable to change the volume from within the game. You need to do it manually (e.g. turn your speakers or headset down). 

Secondly, it took me a while to discover that I could go back to previous levels. This enabled me to show Ainslie the game and to have her attempt the puzzles that I had already completed. However, there is no way for a player to jump forward into the game. This is a detriment to the game as some players may find that they are stuck on one puzzle and are unable to move forward into the game. Certainly, the puzzles are logic based but that doesn't necessarily mean that every player will have the logic required to complete every level. Rather than being required to cheat - searching for the solution online - having the option to advance to the next level would be a nice addition to the game.

Finally, even with the 27 bonus levels added to the game in the first update the game is a little short. Given the price this is only a very minor quibble but the players love the game and want more. Feed them more!

[h1]Is it Steamified?[/h1]

The water for any game on Steam is what makes it Steamified. Unfortunately for Klocki, as good as it is, currently lacks these features. There are no trading cards nor are there any Steam achievements. Adding these featured would give the sales of the game a significant boost. The game is already priced incredibly fairly but the addition of trading cards and achievements would give Steam users the extrinsic reasons to follow through with the purchase.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

Naturally, given how much I enjoyed the game and its stellar price point, Steamified wholly endorses your purchase of this fantastic game. If you're a fan of puzzle games in any way, shape or form then you simply owe it to yourself to have it in your Steam library.

[h1]Steamified[/h1]

For more reviews and our popular giveaways (including hardware) please consider visiting [url=http://www.steamified.com]Steamified[/url].

24452560.review:
Maciej Targoni's second game on Steam, Klocki, is a very simplistic puzzle game where there are no instructions. You must figure out how to connect all the appropriate pieces together and learn as you go to solve each level. Just like Targoni's first game, Hook, it is relaxing, but also a bit challenging. 

I would highly recommend getting this game because you can get a substantial amount of time out of this game for the low price.
 
Minor gripes would be that there is a lack of trading cards, achievements, and numbered levels - which Targoni's previous game featured, but perhaps they will be later added.
 
Also Targoni listens to recommendations from reviewers; I have seen on Hook’s reviews that some people wanted a way to control the music on the game and Targoni has added a function to toggle the audio in Klocki.

If you’re not completely sold on these positive reviews, Targoni has kindly provided a demo version!
www.kongregate.com/games/targaciej/klocki

I hope to see more puzzle games from Maciej Targoni, I will surely support this game developer further.

24426809.review:
A few notes first:
I bought this game for 0.89 cents on the 18th of July 2016.
Just thought I should mention that.

"klocki" is a puzzle game where you must do lots of different things, like link up lines, move peices apart so none of them are close to one another, or whatever else the game throws at you (the pics and videos given give a good idea of what to expect).
After finishing all the puzzles, I can say that the game is quite alot of fun. Finishing puzzles feels rewarding, even thought no rewards are given (if that makes sence).
Also, the game can run smoothly on most PC's or laptops, given that it can run fine on my old PC w/ Windows XP and a potato for a graphics card.

But, one flaw I must point out is the replayibility, or really, the lack of. After you finish the last puzzle, it sends you back to the first puzzle, which confused me for a bit. There was no "Congratulations", no credits, not even a "GG". So, after you finish all the puzzles, thats it. You're done.
Also, IDK if they're adding more puzzles or not (I think they are, check the game description).

Overall, a short puzzle game that took me just over 45 minutes to beat, but never the less, worth the tiny price of 0.99 (even better if you can get it on sale for a few cents).

Edit: Since this review, they've added a good 20 or so levels to the game. :D

24424509.review:
klocki is a casual puzzle game. Puzzles are not hard, once you get the grip of the fairly simple mechanics, they are really easy to solve (you figure out the final state and then simply click long enough for the solution to appear). For what it is, it's perfect, but if you expect any actual depth or the need to think about the puzzles, this game might not be for you.

The aesthetics are clean and minimalistic.

The gameplay length is around 30-45 minutes for the whole game. The hardest puzzle took me around 2 minutes to solve, while the longest (lots of unnecessary clicking) took me around 5. Gor the price, it's expected and I'm fairly positively surprised at the length. 

What I was disappointed with is the absolute lack of options menu. Yes, it's a simple game, but things like resolution and sound options should be present.

There is no text in the game, so it is suitable for everyone, even kids that don't even speak even one language (if they are capable of controlling the computer).

Pick this game if:
- You like simple puzzle games
- You enjoy the minimalistic design
- You want to teach your kids/siblings some logical puzzle solving
- You have 1 €.

Don't pick this game if:
- You expect hard puzzles
- You expect complex mechanics
- You expect hours of fun

24423722.review:
Was dieses Spiel so besonders macht, ist die Tatsache, das es keine Punkte für das lösen von Rätseln gibt, alleine die persönliche Befriedigung es "alleine" gemeistert zu haben! Es gibt auch kein Zeitlimit, jeder ob alt oder jung hat so Spaß beim lösen der immer anspruchsvoller werdenen Aufgaben.

Dieses Spiel fängt ganz leicht an und steigert sich langsamm, so das man immer wieder gut an die neuen Rätseltechniken herangeführt wird. 

Dieses Spiel ist sein Geld wirklich wert (egal ob man nun 0,89 ider 99 Cent bezahlt), hier stimmt einfach alles, die simple Präsentation täuscht auf den ersten Blick, denn die Spielmechanik dahinter ist wirklich sehr ausgereift, man braucht auch keine Sprache um die Rätsel zu lösen denn Logig ist unverell, Es gibt viele verschiedene Rätsel, mal tauscht man Felder,
mal dreht man diese später werden verschiedene Techniken gemischt um das Ziel zu erreichen!

Ein letzter Tip für unentschlossene, spielt einfach die kostenlose Demo an und kauf dann dieses Kleinod.

Ideal für ein paar Rätsel Runden in der Mittagspause oder auch einen langes Rätsel Wochenende!

Ich würde dieses Spiel bzw. einen Nachfolger auf jeden Fall (wieder)kaufen!

24415009.review:
Новая головоломка от создателя Hook. Количество разнообразных механик поражает, но суть сводится к одному — соединить все элементы в непрерывную последовательность (если, конечно, речь не идёт о чёрных квадратах, которые, как раз, надо разделить). Придётся крутить, менять местами, "играть в пятнашки", снова крутить, в общем, делать всё, чтобы таки собрать последовательность.
На первых уровнях казалось, что стоит ввести ограничение по количеству ходов, чтобы играть было не так просто. Чем дальше я проходила — тем больше понимала, что если тут ещё и ходы ограничить, можно будет рвать волосы в бессильной злобе перед непроходимым уровнем.
Ну а так как никаких ограничений нет — это чудесный набор головоломок, который заставит пораскинуть мозгами, но, в то же время, чрезмерно их напрягать не будет.

24412240.review:
Some puzzles are easy. Some puzzles are hard. Some puzzles are just right, like this one.

Some people think the price is too low, which could lead to a poorly-developed game, but this one isn't. Yeah, the price is low but it's a good game that slowly eases you in from easy puzzles where you simply swap pieces around to challenging ones that requires you to rotate, turn, slide, and also having some black tiles that only light up if they're not next to each other.

The best thing about this is game is not the game or the content itself, which is simple but good, but it's about when you start it up: no tutorials, no loading screens, nothing. Just a screen with a puzzle for you to solve, with the help of curiosity on your mind.

看到低廉的游戏价格，我心怀好奇点了进来。
一开始还觉得这种便宜游戏很少有良心作，结果一看：特别好评
评论里都说这游戏休闲益智，我一下就购买了 （反正很便宜）
刚刚花一个小时通了关，发现跟楼上几个评测描述的一模一样：休闲、益智、轻松。
游戏的bgm非常“空灵”（想不到其他形容词），内容大概可以分为几个大关（至于是哪几大关，自己买来玩玩看吧）
前面很简单，后面难度越来越高，甚至还有组合关卡
不过我相信这绝对难不倒聪明的玩家
总之，花五块钱买这游戏，值了！！！

"Инди, казуалка..." - эти слова часто заставляют смотреть на игру предвзято и с отвращением. Но не на эту! Вы только посмотрите на превьюшку, скрины и на цифру 97% (на момент написания обзора) "положительных обзоров". Я лично сразу понял, что эта игра стоящая. Недолго думая я просто продал несколько своих карточек и скачал какие-то 20 мегабайтов игрульки.
 Смысл игры - заставить светится белым все что возможно. Игра хардовая. Но как только я её запустил какое-то время мне она казалась ЧЕРЕЗЧУР казуальной. Думал меня в других обзораз обманули. Но поиграв ещё чуть-чуть я стал способен проходить игру лишь через мозговой штурм. Подсказок тут нет совершенно. Вместо них есть простенькие обучающие уровни для новых элементов пазлов, после которых средний по сложности для закрепления и опять хард.
 Игра радует: минималистичным приятным графоном; ненавязчивым фоновым звуком; множеством различных элементов головоломок; фантазия автора позволившая сделать крайне разнообразные и непохожие уровни; видимое отсутствие багов. Разве что на любителя могут оказаться звуки при кликах на различные элементы (хотя это лишь придирка, так все отлично). Хотелось бы что бы игру обновляли и добовляли новые элементы и уровни. Минусов у неё просто нет и своих 29 рублей она стоит.
 Было бы неплохо увидеть в этой игре ачивки (хотя бы 1 за полное прохождение) и коллекционные карточки :3 А так однозначно рекомендую.

24393464.review:
This was a pretty fun minimalist puzzle game. It kept me interested for quite some time, and would be rather difficult at points (i really fucking hate slider puzzles) but the way it does them is pretty interesting, and not all too difficult. 

Pros: 
Pretty decent puzzle game
Fun for some time
Very Cheap

Cons:
No settings whatsoever - it was made as a kongregate game and was pretty much just ported. It has no settings like resolution, windowed or fullscreen, and i was stuck playing it on one of my side monitors rather than my main monitor because it just locked there
No main screen - It just throws you straight into the game. It wouldn't be that much of a problem if it werent for...
No end screen - The end of the game is a hard puzzle, and then it throws you straight back to the start. I'd prefer a "Thanks for playing!" screen or something with it. 

Things that could be added later on:
Community puzzle creator for steam workshop
Main menu with decent settings - it doesnt have to be Crisis level of settings, just SOME at all would be appreciated
End Screen
maybe a "moves" system for extra challenge. I realize this is mostly a "sit back and relax with some fun brain teasers" game but it could be a lot more.

All in all its a pretty great game.

24390548.review:
Does exactly as it says on the tin.

A short review for a short game:

It won't take hours to complete this game. I think I ran through it in just under an hour without exerting myself too much. It was challenging enough to keep me entertained without being mindlessly irritating. (So no risk of launching my mouse through my PC's monitor, which is always a plus). 

The goal here is to move tiles around to make the required shapes, patterns and lines. This can be done by rotating, sliding or swapping tiles or multiples of tiles dependant on the puzzle. As of now (18th July) there aren't many levels to play through, but they do get increasingly difficult as you progress and there is a sense of achievement later in the game. There is no dialogue and there are no cut scenes, it's just an honest little puzzle game.

TL; DR: When you look at how much you might pay for a AAA title and how many hours you might play it, then it becomes apparent that this really is good value for money. I highly recommend it.

24390250.review:
[h1][b]What is it?[/b][/h1]
Klocki is a simplistic puzzle game that requires you to connect the paths of wires(?) in order to complete each level. Although the first levels are rather simple, things start to make you scratch your head and think about 40 levels in. In total, there are [spoiler]082[/spoiler] levels, each one slightly more challenging than the last. If you enjoy [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/266010]Lyne[/url], [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/265890]Hexcells[/url], and/or [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/367580]Hook[/url] [i](a puzzle game previously created by the same developer! :D)[/i], then I'd recommend you give this a shot as well.

[h1]The Pros[/h1]
* Its simple game play makes Klocki a game that anyone can pick up and play.
* The difficulty of the later puzzles was pleasantly challenging without being hard enough to make someone want to quit.
* Even without any written instructions, Klocki communicates what the player must do only through its level design. This is something I have seen many games try (and fail), and Klocki does it best.
* The graphics and sound, although they may not be complex, combine to create a pleasantly minimalistic work of art.
* I got just over an hour of playtime. Although that doesn't sound like much, that's not bad for a game of this price.

[h1]The Cons[/h1]
* There is no level select menu. If you want to go back (or forward) to an earlier played level, you must click arrows on the bottom corners of the screen.
* The game, although slowly gradually introducing you to new concepts, doesn't feel like a challenge until about half the game. Those familiar with puzzle games may be disappointed in the beginning.
* An disappointing ending. The last level also felt very unsatisfying to complete, being easier than the previous levels you were just completing. After clearing all of the levels, [spoiler]you are simply brought back to the first level. I ended up completing the first two or three levels again thinking "Why are these so easy?"[/spoiler]. [i]Alas, it is only a puzzle game, I'm not sure what I'm expecting for an ending.[/i]
* With all of the aforementioned cons in mind, this only feels like a beta release of the Klocki. I hope an update is released for this game, even if it only adds a few more levels or a level select screen.

[h1]Other notable points[/h1]
* As I predicted, some trading cards were added a few days ago (May 2Xth, 2017)! A single achivement was also added at some point for when you've completed the game.
* There is no score. There is no timer. There is no text. Basically, there is nothing to measure your ability to play the game. It's all up for you to decide.

[h1]The Verdict[/h1]
I recommend you give the game a shot! Although I seem to have written a hefty list of cons, do not let that deter you; they're heavily outweighed by the pros. And, even if the game is fairly short, its price is unbeatable, and you're supporting an awesome indie developer!

[b]Edited on May 28th, 2017[/b] - [i]They added trading cards and a single achivement. Neato.

24381076.review:
This is an awesome game. The mechanc is very minimalistic, it does show instructions, tutorials or demos, and there is no voice explaining what to do. The player has to figure it out for themself what the rules are for how each mechanism works. But this works exceptionally well , as the various mechanisms are presented to the player very naturally, making the player build an intuition on how the game works for themself, which, in my opinion, is the selling point of this game.

I thoroughly enjoyed playing each level, especially the later ones, involving several of the machanisms that have been introduced earlier.

I only hope the developers find the time to create more mechanisms and more difficult levels.

24379295.review:
At less than a dollar, I bought this game on a whim and have been pleasantly surprised. I like puzzle games like Hexcells and while the games are quite different, they have a similar asthetic.

Don't let the extremely simple first few levels fool you into thinking this game will be too easy. The puzzles do get considerably more difficult as new mechanics are introduced.

One other thing I quite like about this puzzle game compared to some is that it's surprisingly refreshing to not have a move counter, or timer, or leaderboard, or "get all the stars" type system. Too often this will cause me to re-play levels, even if they're not enjoyable, only to get a better score. There are no scores in this. Don't get me wrong, at times I like a scoring system, but this game feels more relaxed without it.

If you like puzzle games, pick this up. Well worth the <$1.

24374888.review: Мне действительно нравятся игры от этого автора. Что Hook, что klocki - очень интересные игры. Стоят не дорого, меньше сотни рублей. на прохождения тратится не более 2 часов. Игры похожи, по моему мнению. Мне даже кажется, что идеи для klocki появлялись у создателя прямо во время создания Hook, и на "часиках" он оторвался по полной, создав игру не на одной определённой механике. Во время прохождения вы заметите много разных геймплейных фишек, которые потом будут умело сочетаться между собой на одних уровнях. Во время прохождения вы часто будете спрашивать сами себя "Как?..." в контексте со множистом вопросов, "Он точно хочет сломать мне голову!", подразумевая под словом "он" автора игры. Интересная особенность, что вам будет трудно оторваться от игры, а если вы это и сделаете, то только по причине усталости, так как мозги с каждым уровням кипят всё больше. В начале уровня вы будете топорно смотреть на монитор вашего компьютера, осознавать, на сколько сложен уровень, и думать, стоит ли вообще за него браться. пока вы будете смотреть, вы начнёте замечать особенности уровня, первые шаги к решению начнут приходить вам голову, и вы поспешите их реализовывать. Это вас затянет. Редко когда ваши решения будут неверными, поэтому рисковать всегда есть ризон. После осознания всех тонкостей прохождения уровня, вы приступите к полной его сборке. Эх, какой приток счастья и чувства выполненной работы хлынут на вас большим потоком, когда вы закончите уровень. После, вы захотите узнать, каким будет следующий уровень. "Я просто посмотрю и выключу..." - такая мысль будет промелькать нередко, но так ниразу  не сработает. При виде нового уровня, круг событий повторяется. Каждый уровень уникален и действительно манит, чтобы его скорее прошли так же благодаря тому, что упомянутые выше "фишки игры" умеле переплетаются как на уровне, так и между ними. Они чередуются, давая вашей голове отдохнуть от одной логики и подготовиться к другой. У вас вряд ли получится пройти Hook или klocki за один заход. Лично я делал один перерыв что там, что тут. Поздравляю вас, если вы прошли игру за один раз, но лично я люблю растягивать удовольствие, тем более, игра короткая. Этот факт не должен отталкивать вас. Этот 1 час игры однозначно стоит спрашиваемой с вас суммы. Я взял игру чуть ли не в первый день её выхода, так как следил за ней, поэтому получил скидку. Но, уверяю вас, преобрёл бы её и без всякой скидки. Ведь с вас требуют жалкие *здесь должна была быть цена игры* за такой шедевр! Что Hook, что clocki - игры перепроходимые. Проверено. Но даже если вы пройдёте иё и забудете, она стоит того, чтобы находиться в вашей библиотеке и иногда, когда вы будете на неё натыкаться, напоминать вам о тех славных минутах вашей жизни, когда вы ломали голову над новой загадкой, поставленной таким гениальным человеком, как разработчиком clocki. Так получилось, что я рассказал о двух играх, однако, дело в том, что игры действительно схожи.

看到这个画面风格和价格就入手了，和我预料的一样，一款风格清新简单的解密小游戏。

随便玩了一下，目前为止感觉难度还算简单，有趣但不特别复杂，稍微动动脑筋也就找到方法过关了，作为轻度玩家我其实是挺喜欢这个难度的，和清新的风格一样让人感觉很休闲。

出来瞄了一眼制作的公司，果不其然是HOOK的制作公司。看了看别人的通关时间，估计也是跟HOOK一样短小精悍不过瘾，不过想想5块钱的价格，怎么也算对得起这有趣的一两个小时时间了。

总之，十分推荐轻度玩家购买。

另外想吐槽的是：这游戏是不是有手游版啊，怎么想怎么觉得这类游戏更适合手机碎片化的游戏方式和手机上的轻度玩家们。

Online demo: http://www.kongregate.com/games/targaciej/klocki

This is a very nice little puzzle game that mixes a handful of simple mechanics to result in some fairly complicated levels. I was able to complete all the levels in under an hour (~80 puzzles), but it was a very satisfying, calming experience.

In addition, 27 levels were added at some point before my purchase, so it may not be unlikely that even more are added later.

For less than a dollar, it's a nice experience with a very clean presentation. Sell some trading cards. Try it out.

24354594.review: Klocki is excellent in both aesthetics and execution (and definitely worth more than 1$ USD).  The puzzles require some thought and planning, but are never unapproachable.  The music and art style are minimalist and pleasant.  What delighted me most was the way in which the various individual simpler puzzles were eventually composed into more complicated multi-mechanism levels.  The multi-mechanism puzzles feel like a natural extension of what you've already learned, but require new consideration as you try to fit together multiple constraints at the same time.  definitely a nice time.

24352307.review:
Zenge와 비슷한 미니멀리즘 지향의 퍼즐 게임.
(참고로 이거 만드신 개발자분의 전작이 바로 Hook)

다양한 매커니즘을 통해 퍼즐 상에 존재하는 모든 선을 이어지게끔 만드는 퍼즐 게임이다. 꼭 모든 선을 다 이어지게 만들 필요는 없고, 어쨌든 모든 선이 각자 이어진 형태를 유지하면 풀리는 방식. 처음에는 평면 상에서 퍼즐이 이루어지지만, 나중 가면 입체적인 육면체의 형태에서 퍼즐이 진행되기도 하고,  검은 면을 따로 떨어뜨려야 한다던가, 같은 색깔의 면을 모두 이어지게 둔다던가 하든 또 다른 매커니즘도 차례차례 등장한다.

그래도 한 눈에 게임의 룰은 쉽게 이해할 수 있는 편. 의외로 룰 설명 제대로 안해놓고 대충 내던져둬서 플레이어로 하여금 벙찌게 만드는 퍼즐 게임들이 적지 않은데, 이 게임은 그런 점에선 확실히 훌륭하다. 처음 보는 매커니즘이 등장해도 곧잘 어렵지 않게 이해하고 풀어나갈 수 있게끔 디자인이 되어있다. 최대한 효율적인 방식으로 미니멀리즘을 추구한 모습. 단 스테이지가 많지 않아 플레이타임도 미니멀리즘을 추구했다는 점이 못내 아쉽다. (본인기준 1시간)

미니멀리즘을 추구한 점이라던가, 잔잔한 분위기의 음악이 흘러나온다던가 하는 점은 Zenge와 여러모로 유사하다. Zenge에서 예술성을 조금 희생한 대신, 퍼즐 자체의 기전에 충실한 게 바로 이 게임이라고 봐도 될 것이다.

P.S! 역시나 도전과제가 없지만, Zenge와 마찬가지로 개발자가 도전과제와 트레이딩 카드 추가에 낙관적인 것으로 보인다.

http://blog.naver.com/kitpage/220764322722

24346429.review: WOW.. juste wow, ce jeux est totalement parfait. Moi qui n'aime pas les puzzle, j'ai ete surpris par cette merveille. Bien que je l'ai pris a rabais, ce jeux ma surpris. Le systeme de gameplay quoi qu'il n'est pas complexe :) fit totalement. Les couleur sont belle et vive, nous rendant dans un etat de calme et de concentration assez fort. La musique, calme, mais puissante par ces effet d'aggrandissement est totalement completive au jeux. Les effets sonore de chaque ''plaquette'', levier et pivot sont unque pour que chacun se demarque, fesant en sorte ne jammais se tromper dans nos manoeuvre. Des niveau facile et PAF, un niveau assez complexe nous est donner pour nous casser le cerveau, et ensuite il laisse place a d'autre facile et ainsi de suite.. Le seul point negatif est que nous n'avons aucune idee nous somme rendue a qu'elle niveau.. j'ai passer une heure sans savoir combien j'en ai passer. Je le reccomande vraiment. 9,9999999/10. juste parfait

24345816.review:
Juego de más o menos 1 hora (Tengo 2 horas porque deje abierta la aplicación), tiene una gran variedad de figuras y maneras para resolver los puzzles como rotar la figura, figuras no movibles, figuras que solo se pueden deslizar, figuras que se pueden intercambiar, bloques que necesitan estar distanciadas de otras iguales, etc.
Creo que este juego tiene 2 días en el mercado pero por lo que veo el creador quiere introducir más niveles, el juego no cuenta con un tutórala o algo parecido pero como es sencillo de entender lo que hace es poner 3-4 niveles sencillos para que entiendas la mecánica y luego aumenta la dificultad. 


La gran mayoría de niveles son cortos, la interfaz es muy sencilla teniendo solo 2 cosas música (Desactivar o activar) y las flechas que sirven para cambiar entre los niveles pero al no tener un menú si por ejemplo quieres pasar del nivel 1 hasta el nivel 15 tienes que ir de 1 en 1 en otras palabras darle a la flecha 14 veces hasta llegar al nivel 15 esto aumenta si quieres avanzar más niveles.


Conclusión: Si tomamos en cuenta el precio y la duración no está mal suponiendo que te guste el género, estaría mejor unas 2 horas más de duración que en juegos como LYNE (Mejor que este) son de +15 horas con niveles nuevos cada día. Mi nota sería de un 8/10 porque lo único que veo importante de corregir es el menú y aumentar la duración, pero tiene muy buena variedad por lo cual no es aburrido estar con la misma mecánica.

PD: Olvide mencionar que tienes que unir todo el circuito es una línea o varias que tiene que iniciar y terminar en algún punto.

24332386.review:
ピースの場所を変えたり、回転させたり、時にはスライドさせたりして線を繋げたり、形を作ったりするパズルゲーム。

このパズルゲームを選ぶ最大の利点は、プレイヤーを飽きさせないことにある。
通常のパズルゲームは難易度が上がってもやることは変わらず、徐々にめんどくさくなって最後には苦行にもなっていることがあるだろう。
だがこのパズルゲームは、プレイヤーがあるタイプのパズルをある程度こなし飽きが見えてくるタイミングで新たな要素を加えたり、ゲームの種類が変わったりするのだ。(今まで場所を変えて解くものだったのが、回転させて解くタイプのパズルになったりする)
最初の方はもちろん簡単だが、最後の方になると今まで出てきた種類のタイプが組み合わさり、問題が出されるので少々頭を使うことになる。

パズルゲームで最後までだれることがなく、やりきったのはこのゲームが初めてかもしれない。
セールで88円になっていたがカードも無いしすぐ終わるので、本当に暇つぶし程度に考えてもらっていい。
ちなみに私は、46分程で全部終わりました。
アップデートで問題が追加されるかも知れないけどそれは考えてないです。

24331054.review:
Like Hook, the previous game by the same developer, klocki is a minimalist puzzle game.

By minimalist, understand that there is:
[list]
    [*] [b]little to no interface[/b] (a button to mute sounds, another to call up arrows allowing you to go to the previous or next puzzle and that is it... not even a way to play the game windowed and you quit by pressing escape)
    [*] [b]no tutorial[/b] (but the mechanics are self-explanatory) 
    [*] [b]no bells and whistles[/b] (no achievements, no trading cards... in fact the game won't even tell you when you're done, it'll just cycle back to the first puzzle and there is no tool at all to track your progress, puzzles are not even numbered)
[/list]

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
    [*] Beautiful and slick graphics
    [*] Interesting and intuitive mechanics
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
    [*] Minimalism taken so far it impedes the experience
    [*] Very very short game
[/list]

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
klocki is worth the very small price it is set at, but if the author wants more money for their next game, they'll have to start working on creating user interfaces...

24330702.review:
Conceptional Shortage

The game is amazing. The concept really shines, there is a feel of polish in the movements of the plates and new features are freaquently introduced to keep things interesting.
In general it´s a unique idea that i´ve not seen so far with amazing gameplay innovations.

The problem however is that it´s too easy and as a result of that, too short. Nearly all puzzles solve themselves, i personally only had to think on the second last one. And i was done after only 30 minutes.
It´s sad as that one difficult level showed me what could have been possible with this, if the levels were better designed to not give a solution on 90% of all pieces (as they only have one spot they could possibly fit in), making the other 10% easy to match the resulted pattern.

But still, i had a great time in this game, and so will you. If you´re looking for an amazing and innovative puzzle game, this will most likly blow your mind. But if you´re looking for something more open ended on the difficulty, you may be disappointed...

EDIT:
As people start to say that i didn´t recommend the game  even tho i did, i might have to clarify. Sure the games mechanics work great and feel amazing, BUT if you are not specificly looking for that, and that alone, i don´t recommend the game to you.
It doesn´t matter how itricate and amazing the mechanics work if the game just gives you the solutions to nearly every level while being this short. If you look at SpaceChem, SquareLogic, Sokobond or Hexcells, the mechanics also are innovative and amazing. But they actually have a loooot more difficult levels in them so that you can spend a lot of time in them.
If i play a puzzle game, i want to look at the screen and think of what i actually have to do. Simply rotating around some tiles until they fit a pattern for 30 minutes did not do it for me.
Is the game well designed and its mechanics a blast? Sure. But that is not the only thing a puzzle game should have in my opinion...

Игра очень простая, слишком простая для головоломки. Никаких настроек экрана, экрана выбора уровня, ну или хотя бы чётких инструкций о том, как перейти на чёртов следующий уровень. В Puzzler World головоломок гораздо больше, в большем ассортименте, более сложных и более удобных, хотя он расчитан, вроде, на детей. А здесь всё становится просто, когда допираешь до простой логики (здесь не должно выходить скраю, надо повернуть). Тут есть два одинаковых уровня! Не, они выглядят разными, но, по сути, являются одним и тем же. (уровень с пятнашкаи на 9 клеточном поле, центральное вращается). К слову, вся игра пройдена меньше чем за 2 часа, я могу её просто вернуть в магазин, но не буду.
Не худшая игра, в которую я играл, да и люблю я головоломки:
6 из 10

24327945.review:
I played the developers first game, hook, and honestly while it didn't stay with me and I gave up on it, it was a very competantly made and designed puzzle game, that at first looked like it was fairly simple, but ended up getting too complex, and after playing the game for roughly half an hour, klocki seems to prove that hook wasn't a fluke.

there's a lot of smart design in this simple game, not just in the puzzles themselves but in how they are tought, compared to the almost full price game 'the witness' klocki teaches you its mechanics clearly and concisely, I havn't run into a puzzle that confused me yet.

for about a dollar this game is well worth it, especially if you like puzzle games there is no reason not to buy klocki.

24324101.review:
今の味に飽きてきた頃合でタイミング良く次のファストフードを出してくれる、そんなパズルゲーム。
よくある同じロジックのパズルをカレンダーの如く山積みにしたものとは違うので、サクサク新鮮な気持ちで最後まで遊べます。

内容としては見た目どおりのパネル操作式のパズルで、最初は単純なルールの数秒で解けるパズルから始まります。
慣れてくるに連れ徐々に要素が増えていき、後半は少し悩まないと解き方が分からないぐらいの難易度になります。

誰かのアイデアに触れる媒介としてパズルが好きな人には、本一冊分ぐらいのアイデアが詰まっている良いパズルです。
一人の人間のこの量のアイデアが100円で買えるのは、デジタルの特権かなと思います。

24313976.review:
Стал всё чаще подмечать минималистичные головоломки в Стиме.
Надеюсь, что это не случайности, а тенденция, ибо все они восхитительны.
В качестве примеров - Hook, KNIGHTS (так же есть проект hocus, но субъективно не зашёл, хоть и сама идея кажется мне интересной). Так вот этот список можно смело пополнять klocki.
Поиграл совсем немного, но обязательно игру добью и не потеряю, ибо остался в восторге ещё от Hook этого же разработчика.
У него так же имеется проект оО, но он не про шевеление извилинами, а про шустрые жамканья по пробелу, совмещённые с испытанием на термостойкость вашего стула.

В игре ничего не объясняется, но она как и Hook построена так, что делая первые робкие клики, вам начнёт казаться, что игра не просто понятна, но и проста, и как только эта мысль поселится у вас в голове, автор резко покажет, что у него есть козыри в рукаве, рано радуетесь.

Вообще, по-английски "puzzle" означает "головоломка", но забавно то, что весь принцип решения местных головоломок как раз-таки очень схож с собиранием мозайки, только разнообразнее и интереснее.

Maciej, we will be waiting more you're games
Thank u for you're work
And i hope price for russians 26\29 rub will be so long how it possible.

24312283.review:
So, minimalist puzzle game by the same person behind Hook.  This time you are matching lines on puzzle pieces to create a path by replacing one with another, sliding them or rotating them and in later levels sometimes all at once.  To add complexity you can even rotate entire sides or even just parts of the sides.  While the game never gets too complex, there is a level of difficulty in the last few puzzles that requires a bit of thought and planning.

The soundtrack is very soothing and the graphics great reminiscent of Zenge, not by this author, but without the overarching story.

I have no idea how many levels there were (50?, 60?), keeping with the minimalist theme there is no counter or selection scene, could have used one.  The game ended when it wrapped around to the first level again.  The game only took me about an hour, but for the very minimalist amount of less than one dollar, Klocki is a great little game worthy of your time.

Completed this game in ~77 mins. Klocki is a very relaxing, creative puzzle game with interesting puzzle mechanics. I really enjoyed playing it!
Klocki being a minimal puzzle game, no instructions were provided, however, no instructions were needed; just you and the puzzle. It takes advantage of its simple and colourful design, making it easy enough for the player to figure out what new shapes and colours do what, whilst still maintaining an element of mystery. This gives the player room to explore the puzzles in their own time with no time pressure. 

I would reccommend this game to anyone and everyone, puzzle lovers, and those who need a bridge between other games.

I must also add that the sound design is delicious and really added to the game's feedback! The music is beautiful!
At £0.79 you can't go wrong!

24303672.review:
klocki is a casual puzzle game

The game has 80 levels and takes about an hour to do. There aren't any instructions, but the mechanics are easy to figure out, and the puzzles are quite small and not hard to solve, either. A lot of the mechanics involve sliding and tapping, which means the game is well suited to touch surfaces.

But it definitely isn't difficult. It uses the 3 dimensions well, but all of the puzzles are rather small, and all of the different mechanics (swapping, rotating, sliding) are never explored to a depth where they would pose anything like a conundrum. I found [i]Hook[/i] more challenging, and even that wasn't difficult.

If you're looking for a short casual puzzler, this game and its price would be ok.

P.S.: This game takes longer to idle for cards than to actually play.

[i]This game runs well on my old Windows XP computer, but I needed to hold the shift key while starting the game to get a settings dialog where I resized it.[/i]

24303008.review:
This game seems a lot longer than [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/367580/] HOOK [/url], but it really isn't! The difficulty of the game gives it its extra boost of time played which results is making it seem a lot longer / time consuming,

I am so far away from completing the game and I said to the creator, [url=https://twitter.com/targaciej] Maciej Targoni [/url], that I was "Going to play now, once I complete it I'll review it." But due to how long it's taken for me to my current level I wanted to review it now as I want as many people to play this as in his words, he "want[s] to be a master of 0,99 puzzle games ;)" (79p in the UK! :p), and I feel like he can easily become just that if he continues with what he is doing but at the same time he makes sure each game is completely different! [url=http://imgur.com/a0zMCWZ] The conversation snippet here! [/url]

The designs of the game, just like [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/367580/] HOOK [/url], are very simplistic but this is a good thing. The design makes you focus on the puzzle rather than everything else, this also makes you stay on track and thus makes you determined to keep completing and digging down deeper into the masses of puzzles [url=https://twitter.com/targaciej] Maciej[/url], has made. 

There are A LOT of new things that gets put into the puzzles every few levels from sliding, to rotating blocks to 3 - 4 lines at once on screen! All these new things do not over complicate the game, but it adds to the challenge and it's beauty but it also make you sit back and just think to yourself.

This is a game that you'd sit down alone when it's quiet to pass time, but it can also be a game you get your mates to try to see them struggle and then show them the answers and show off and look like the "smart" one of the group or you' just horribly fail on a level and join your mates down on the ladder.

The only citizism I have is that there's no numbers to signify the level you're on, something [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/367580/] HOOK [/url] did have which I found useful. It was something I could look forward to, seeing the next number appear and begin to count down to 50.

I got this game for free via [url=https://twitter.com/targaciej] Maciej Targoni [/url]. I asked for a code and sent that one to a friend of mine, [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/mOOrsey122/] Pyrocanoe [/url], who saw the game and decided to put the game on his wishlist. He'll be playing it later and I'll be sure to tag Pyrocanoe's review here once he decides to review it!

24299980.review:
[h1] 《klocki》——Minimal but Complex	[/h1]
看似简单，实则内涵丰富的解谜小游戏。
[h1] 先说优点	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]极简主义。画面干净简约，游戏整体UI和《HOOK》类似，看着很舒服。
    [*]82关的长度，物美价廉。对于一个售价6元初上架5元的游戏，82关的容量绝对对得起这个价格。
    [*]玩法丰富。“Minimal but Complex”——这是我对这个游戏的第一印象。游戏以“接水管”为核心，加入了“不相邻”、“数字推盘”及“整体旋转”等元素，降低了屡次出现相同玩法的枯燥性。后期会出现多种上述元素的混合关卡，增加了关卡的多元化。
[/list]
...
[h1] 不足	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]难度过低。游戏的通关方式过于“清晰可见”，很多时候都不需要动脑，而是简单的位移操作。
另外，“维数限制”——即纵向的拼块只能与纵向的拼块交换这一设定，也将关卡的难度被限制在了很低的水平。
    [*]重复性。关卡重复性太明显，部分解谜方式存在着重复。例如弧形的的拼块与最初始的连线含义明显相似。
[/list]
...
总体来说，这是一款非常不错的解谜小游戏，虽然流程不是很长（本人用了1小时不到通关），但作为一款低价小游戏，还是很值得一试的。
...
[spoiler] 很抱歉我全程外方音乐把游戏的音乐关了听的网易云...所以不知道背景音乐是什么样的..	[/spoiler]

24298173.review:
A+ grid/shape puzzles.

Klocki starts off as reminiscent of the puzzle game "Loop", in which you swap tiles until the lines inscribed upon them are arranged to create an unbroken circuit (or, in some cases, several unbroken circuits).

Klocki, however, incorporates a greater number of shape formats and tile manipulation methods. Some puzzles involve swapping tiles, some involve rotating tiles, some involve sliding tiles around on the grid, some even involve rotating whole segments of the puzzle landscape. The shape objectives vary as well. Some puzzles are about creating a continuous line, others about filled shapes, and others about keeping matching tiles from touching.

I didn't want to call this a "short" game, since my speedy completion could be chalked up to my being so enthralled with the game, but puzzle lovers will probably only need about a half hour (which is truly not bad for the asking price). I assume I completed all the available puzzles, because eventually my progress looped around to the beginning again.

The "minimalist" tag is no joke. The graphics are clean and simple (although some of the colors could stand to be tweaked). In lieu of a tutorial, the game (thankfully) presents you with extremely tiny puzzles to force you to experience the new mechanics through doing, not reading. The interface is minimalistic to a fault. There is apparently no menu. If the game is running, it is displaying a puzzle. You can mute/unmute and you can skip forward/backward through puzzles you've already beaten. There is no table of contents, no volume adjustment (I was hoping to lower SFX and raise music), and no "exit" button.

I really hope that additional puzzles will be available a some point in the future, even as paid DLC. I feel like some of the puzzle mechanics weren't fully exhausted here and there's plenty of potential for more content.

24297723.review:
制作组的上一部作品是《HOOk》。
本作依旧延续了《HOOK》的优点：[b]操作简单（点点点），谜题多变，画面干净，音乐空灵。音效方面则是配合游戏的美工，换成了科幻风格，听起来还是很舒服的。[/b]
玩法：这款游戏可以视作[b]接水管游戏的升级版，但是相对来说复杂了很多。[/b]“管线”有的可以互换位置，有的可以转动方向，而且有时候两条管线在同一个砖块上，转动或移位的时候必须同时考虑，同时黑色砖块又有类似黑白棋的变化，不能挨在一起...然后谜题一开始是单平面谜题，后来变成多平面，然后是立方体，多个立方体...
怎么样，是不是感觉有些乱了呢？
没错，在我看来，[b]本作最大的问题就在于：内容较多，变化太快，以至于游戏的规则和目标都变得模糊不清了。[/b]和《HOOK》简简单单的“不能让钩子卡住”这个明确的目标相比，本作的解谜目标非常的模糊：一开始似乎是所有管线连接起来就可以，但后来你会发现不全部连起来也行，目标似乎变成了拼出对称图形就行，但紧接着下一个关卡又推翻了这个结论...
在玩这款游戏之前，我觉得解谜游戏再难无非就是解谜的时间长一些，但现在我明白了，最难的游戏是这样的：[b]谜题都解开了，你都还没弄懂解谜的规则是什么！[/b]
毫不夸张，就是这样的，我好几次解决了谜题之后，在下一关才发现自己之前的思路是错的，然后倒回之前的关卡，发现了新的规则，然后过了一关之后，才发现这个思路也是错的！然而这些错误的思路却又确实解开了前面的关卡...所以我完全搞不懂了，真感觉自己是在用本能玩解谜游戏...
总的来说就是这样了，这款游戏不能说是不好，虽然[b]也就是一款手机益智游戏的规格 [/b]，但画面音乐音效什么的都不错，算是对得起这个价格。最大的问题就是，[b] 这款游戏让人多多少少有点玩不明白。 [/b]
所以结论就是，  [b] 买这款游戏之前，还是先详细调查，慎重考虑吧。[/b]

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
另外要说一下支持27种语言的问题，为啥这游戏这么厉害呢？因为这款游戏里根本连一个文字都没有啊！

24297587.review:
From the developer of Hook, Klocki is a minimalistic puzzle with not so simple puzzles. Klocki uses how the player learns through gameplay to drive the puzzle mechanics. As you get the hang of it, puzzles become more difficult. Each new mechanic bleeds from a previous one, and will shows up with previous ones to create a complicated puzzle. 
By looking at the puzzles for the first time, you can easily get an overwhelmed feeling that it has to be hard. As you move some pieces around, you get an "Aha!" moment and realize the puzzle is actually simple. 
Just be prepared to be stuck on multiple puzzles for a couple minutes before figuring out the solution. It certainly is worth a dollar and the time you will spendwithin it.

39159401.review:
不到一个小时就通关了。
表示根本不够玩啊！！
就像花5块钱买了瓶饮料那样意犹未尽。

首先是游戏内容方面，通过旋转、平移等拼接插头，构成富有美感的闭合图形。
非常新颖的解谜方式，花样也层出不穷。
不足的是很多关卡都属于教程关卡（裸题），综合关卡（综合题）太少，也就导致整体的解谜难度不会太难。
不过这一定程度上也为喜爱解谜的玩家们保持了解谜的乐趣。
（关于关卡难度方面，某些关卡看似困难，实际上关卡内处处都有提示，从提示入手就很容易解出）

还有一点让我感觉买这款游戏不亏的是，游戏的画面带给人的舒适感。
游戏的画面极其简洁，甚至连开始界面都没有，全程都要靠玩家自己摸索。
加之游戏本身玩法的休闲性，完全可以作为工作或学习之余放松的一款游戏。
游戏的休闲性……也算是一种个人喜好吧。

39140611.review: A fun little game I enjoy playing, and a great time killer. Would recommend.

39128565.review:
Um die Ecke gedacht.

klocki ist ein kleines Denk-Spiel, wo man Felder austauscht, dreht, und durch die Gegend schiebt. Dabei ist man immer drauf bedacht, gewisse Regeln einzuhalten, die einem nach und nach beigebracht werden. Dabei ist die Vielfalt und die Verbindungen, wie man die Welt manipulieren kann umfangreich und mit steigendem Schwierigkeitsgrad eingesetzt.

Grafisch und soundtechnisch ist das Spiel eher minimalistisch, aber vollkommen ausreichend. Eine Story gibt es nicht. Hier geht es ganz allein um die Rätsel, die man lösen soll.

Wer also ein recht einfaches, aber schön gemachtes Denkspiel haben möchte, der kann sich klocki gern mal ansehen. Wer denkt, dass Denken nicht sein Spezialgebiet ist, der sollte darüber nachdenken, von diesem Denkspiel die Finger zu lassen ... denke ich.

39098342.review: Awesome little game. Took me 45 minutes to play through. The learning curve is nice, the difficulty is so that you can solve all levels in one go but still feel quite challenged at times. Like Hook, part of the fun is figuring out how the parts work but since there are more different mechanics present here in the later levels the added complexity of having to find out how the different parts work together in this particular level adds a whole lot of fun and complexity. A definite must for puzzle fans looking for something fun, challenging for one evening.
